0,"

My Boyfriend’s Briefs™ is a new luxurious feeling designer underwear line made just for a woman, to fit the curves of a woman. Created by parent company R’Lano Brands, My Boyfriend's Briefs™ features a newly designed Women’s Briefettes™ (a feminine boxer brief style underwear) made from fabrics that bring you the most comfortable, softest fit ever all cut, sewn and assembled in Austin, Texas
column2:
packaged and shipped out of Abilene, Texas.

My Boyfriend's Briefs™ offers basic everyday solid colors made from the softest Rayon (from Bamboo)/Cotton/Spandex blend. Our fun and sometimes funky Prints are made of Cotton/Spandex blend that gives you the absolute best comfort and fit that keeps you fresh all day long. The best part of our company is that our garments are MADE IN TEXAS!

column1: My inspiration for our Briefettes™ came from wearing my husband’s boxer briefs and loving them (long story there, but needless to say I couldn't call them My Husband's Briefs, just doesn't sound as catchy). I tried some of the boy shorts, full briefs and other boxer styles that are offered for women but could never get the same coverage and comfort. Most women's boxers availble from big name companies still have the fly or male pocket design, or a front or back seam and tags. So after searching for an answer and not finding anything AMERICAN MADE I decided to start My Boyfriend's Briefs™ and the rest is history. I hope you enjoy your Briefettes™ as much as I do and Thank You for Supporting My Campaign. #BriefHugs #MyBoyfriendsBriefs
Our Mission is to give you what you are looking for in choosing underwear - comfort, fit, softness, excellence quality and style
column2: my new line of Briefettes™ offer you all of that and more. Made in the USA - bringing American Made products right to your doorstep.

column1: Because of our mission, we spent months researching fabrics, manufacturers, methods used and experience in choosing our partners. We searched high and low for the perfect manufacturer and we found them right here in Texas. After numerous emails and phone calls to various factories all across the nation, we found one in the outskirts of Austin. Their Mission Statement is: “We are committed to job creation, education and bringing American Made products to American people.” A match made in Heaven!

Tina, Esther and the team have helped me to perfect the fit of our Briefettes™, and educate me along the way so I can provide you with an utmost premium luxurious quality product. I am absolutely in love with our Briefettes™ and I am confident that you will be too.

Our Briefettes™ are designed by a woman for a woman. After researching and not finding what I envisioned I decided to go to the drawing board and design what I consider to be the perfect underwear - made to fit a woman’s curves.

Our Briefettes™ are the most comfortable fit with a softness that feels so luxurious you will never go back to regular panties. Made so they never ride up or give you wedges, they are seamless in the front and back panels and made with a 4” inch inseam to cover up any cheekiness. Offering two styles - low rise and full briefettes. They also come tag less and all have 100% cotton lining crotch, giving you extra absorbency and no irritation from tags. BONUS!!

Made from fabrics like natural Cotton and Rayon from Bamboo fibers, our Briefettes™ are made for durability, comfort and most of all softness. All contain a small percentage of spandex that gives you the maneuverability and durability you need for every day wear. Going a step further, we designed a crop top and bralette to make it a complete set for you. Support, wireless and no bra closures... what else could a lady ask for! (Not available with all prints.)

When considering fabrics we had 3 goals: comfort, softness and durability. We experimented with cotton, polyester, modal, rayon, lace and other common fabrics and found that rayon from bamboo was one of the softest fabrics with lasting durability. So we decided to make our solid color Briefettes™ of rayon from bamboo/cotton/spandex blend (200 gsm) giving them long lasting durability even after numerous wash and wear. Made from the pulp of bamboo grass, Rayon from Bamboo fabric is light and strong and it does not build up static electricity. Our rayon fabric supplier also holds an OEKO-TEX® Standard 100 certified in natural and sustainable knitted fabrics.
Our Print Briefettes™ are made from 95% cotton
column2: cotton is perhaps the most popular fiber for fabric in the world. It is soft, comfortable and breathes well. Both fabrics contain a small percentage of Spandex, also known as Elastane, it is durable and resistant to moisture. Did I mention that all of our Briefettes™ come with 100% cotton lining! I buy all my fabrics from USA suppliers. Some fabrics are made in the USA and some are imported.

column1: OUR LOGO WAISTBAND is made of the highest and softest quality woven elastic. I sampled various elastics from all across the nation and found a great partner in California. Albert and Tom have been wonderful to work with. I required elastic that was lightweight, durable for long lasting, but absolutely had to be soft to the touch. Our partner provided what I required and holds up to our high standards of ethics and labor laws. I am really excited to work with them on our designs and love our finished products.

At R'Lano Brands LLC, we believe we can improve people's lives through national and local community partnerships. We understand the importance for our company to operate responsibly and know that you want to buy from a company that works hard to integrate sustainable and responsible practices into all that we do. That is why giving back is an important part of our daily business and once our website launches you can see the different charitable organizations that we are working with in various social arenas. Every purchase of our Briefettes™ allows us to contribute to someone in need. #BriefHug
Our products are estimated to retail between $32-$36 dollars due to my decision to use Ethical and Local Manufacturing companies in the USA and keep Americans working
column2: also, the fabrics, elastic and other materials are all top quality. I am making every effort to work with manufacturers who produce our raw materials in the United States creating additional work for people here. With your help, we can place a much larger order to bring you our Briefettes™ at the best price. Depending on which reward you choose, a pair can be delivered to you in our custom designed mailer box for an Early Bird contribution of $26 dollars. We will also be able to introduce the Wedding Collection if we reach the necessary goal of $15,500 and our Active Wear if we reach $25,000.

column1: Help us get the word out! Please share this project with your friends, family and social media connections. And to make it easy on you, there’s an easy “Share this Project” button on the project website that lets you share on Facebook, Twitter, E-mail, or a letter in a bottle. So, share away my friends!
TRUE TO SIZE: Our Briefettes™ are designed to fit the curves of a woman. To measure, run a tape measure around your waist and measure hand to hand for a comfortable fit.

Risks and challenges

Once My Boyfriend’s Briefs™ is successfully funded, I'll do my best to make sure everything goes according to plan to meet the promised deadline. I have manufacturing, operations, and logistics set up and ready to go. The funding raised on this campaign will be used for production and manufacturing. Although we do not see any direct risks and challenges, there are always indirect or unseen tasks that may present itself during the process of production so we'll keep everyone posted and make sure we live up to our end of the bargain.

I believe our fans are part of our team, and therefore you will be kept up to date — not only as this campaign, but even after and beyond. Complete transparency is important to us, so you can follow all the behind-the-scenes fun (and sometimes stressful) processes of starting and running a small business.

That being said I am so grateful to you for stepping out in faith with me on this incredible journey. I can't thank you enough.

Sandra Arellano Minnick, Founder

Made from the pulp of bamboo grass, Rayon from Bamboo fabric is light and strong and it does not build up static electricity. Our rayon fabric supplier also holds an OEKO-TEX® Standard 100 certified in natural and sustainable knitted fabrics.
Our Print Briefettes™ are made from 95% cotton
column2: cotton is perhaps the most popular fiber for fabric in the world. It is soft, comfortable and breathes well. Both fabrics contain a small percentage of Spandex, also known as Elastane, it is durable and resistant to moisture. Did I mention that all of our Briefettes™ come with 100% cotton lining! I buy all my fabrics from USA suppliers. Some fabrics are made in the USA and some are imported.

column1: OUR LOGO WAISTBAND is made of the highest and softest quality woven elastic. I sampled various elastics from all across the nation and found a great partner in California. Albert and Tom have been wonderful to work with. I required elastic that was lightweight, durable for long lasting, but absolutely had to be soft to the touch. Our partner provided what I required and holds up to our high standards of ethics and labor laws. I am really excited to work with them on our designs and love our finished products.

At R'Lano Brands LLC, we believe we can improve people's lives through national and local community partnerships. We understand the importance for our company to operate responsibly and know that you want to buy from a company that works hard to integrate sustainable and responsible practices into all that we do. That is why giving back is an important part of our daily business and once our website launches you can see the different charitable organizations that we are working with in various social arenas. Every purchase of our Briefettes™ allows us to contribute to someone in need. #BriefHug
Our products are estimated to retail between $32-$36 dollars due to my decision to use Ethical and Local Manufacturing companies in the USA and keep Americans working
column2: also, the fabrics, elastic and other materials are all top quality. I am making every effort to work with manufacturers who produce our raw materials in the United States creating additional work for people here. With your help, we can place a much larger order to bring you our Briefettes™ at the best price. Depending on which reward you choose, a pair can be delivered to you in our custom designed mailer box for an Early Bird contribution of $26 dollars. We will also be able to introduce the Wedding Collection if we reach the necessary goal of $15,500 and our Active Wear if we reach $25,000.

column1: Help us get the word out! Please share this project with your friends, family and social media connections. And to make it easy on you, there’s an easy “Share this Project” button on the project website that lets you share on Facebook, Twitter, E-mail, or a letter in a bottle. So, share away my friends!
TRUE TO SIZE: Our Briefettes™ are designed to fit the curves of a woman. To measure, run a tape measure around your waist and measure hand to hand for a comfortable fit.

Risks and challengesOnce My Boyfriend’s Briefs™ is successfully funded, I'll do my best to make sure everything goes according to plan to meet the promised deadline. I have manufacturing, operations, and logistics set up and ready to go. The funding raised on this campaign will be used for production and manufacturing. Although we do not see any direct risks and challenges, there are always indirect or unseen tasks that may present itself during the process of production so we'll keep everyone posted and make sure we live up to our end of the bargain.I believe our fans are part of our team, and therefore you will be kept up to date — not only as this campaign, but even after and beyond. Complete transparency is important to us, so you can follow all the behind-the-scenes fun (and sometimes stressful) processes of starting and running a small business.That being said I am so grateful to you for stepping out in faith with me on this incredible journey. I can't thank you enough.Sandra Arellano Minnick, Founder",20.0,0,"1 Campaign

I am Director of Onyx Cosmetic Beauty Clinic and a mother of two toddlers. Throughout my career customers and colleagues have all discussed with me the concept of skin in care and in particular safe ways to remove make up without the use of harsh chemicals. I always thought there was a solution on the shelf for all needs. I soon discovered this was not the case. It wasn't till I had children that did I realise how much time and expense I put into my beauty cleansing regime. Being time poor and on a budget I was constantly looking for the 'Magic' solution and I couldn't find one anywhere that allowed me to remove my make up quickly and efficiently while not harming the skin. So I decided that since I couldn't find the solution that I should make one and with encouragement from my husband, family and friends that is what I did.
• A make up removing mitt that removes ALL make up just with the use of water.
• Replaces the need for all make up removing cleansers.
• Is chemical free, making it safe to use and environmentally friendly.
• Is easy to clean with warm soapy water.
• Last on average 18 months before needing to consider replacing.
• A regular cloth has straight fibres and works similar to a broom that only pushes dirt back and forward, which means very little make up and dirt is removed from the skin.

• The unique weave of the Magic Facial Mitt, means that the fibres are looped in a criss cross fashion. This means that dirt and make up gets trapped within these loops, when you lift the Magic Facial Mitt off the skin it lifts with it all the dirt and make up.
Receive 1 x Pink Magic Facial Mitt in Retail Box.

The Magic Facial Mitt is made using our unique micro fibre that  removes make up effectively with just the use of warm water.
Get rid of all your cleansing products and make up wipes, remove your make up in a safe, chemical free and environmentally friendly way.
Receive 1 x Limited Edition Lilac Magic Facial Mitt in Retail Box.

The Magic Facial Mitt is made using our unique micro fibre that  removes make up effectively with just the use of warm water.
Get rid of all your cleansing products and make up wipes, remove your make up in a safe, chemical free and environmentally friendly way.
Receive 2 x Pink Magic Facial Mitt in Retail Boxes.

One for you and one for your best friend.
The Magic Facial Mitt is made using our unique micro fibre that  removes make up effectively with just the use of warm water.
Get rid of all your cleansing products and make up wipes, remove your make up in a safe, chemical free and environmentally friendly way.
Receive 3 x Pink Magic Facial Mitt in Retail Boxes.

One for you and two for gifting the ultimate deal for our super fans.
The Magic Facial Mitt is made using our unique micro fibre that  removes make up effectively with just the use of warm water.
Get rid of all your cleansing products and make up wipes, remove your make up in a safe, chemical free and environmentally friendly way.
By supporting my campaign I will be able to achieve the following that without this support I will not be able to achieve:
• Manufacture and bring my product to market.
• Be able to take my product to retailers for placing into retail stores.
• Allow me to run a marketing and promotional programme to promote my product.

column11:
> 

NEW BRITISH BRIDAL DESIGN COLLECTION

A contemporary approach to bridal design is the Pearlarose signature style - a style            modernised yet revolutionary
column13:
the 'new' vintage!

An eclectic new collection inspired by the magical classics of a whimsical era.  Bringing  affordable heritage-driven, vintage- inspired gowns to life.

Designed for the fashion-forward bride, Pearlarose gowns are enhanced with delicate vintage style laces, soft feminine tulles and luxurious silky satins.
column16: >'The past creates but a reflection of our future... what is old, eventually becomes new.
column19: >A Pearlarose gown is a timeless heirloom to treasure forever...
column22:
>‘Pearlarose provides gowns for the budget conscious bride looking for vintage dresses with a twist.

Boasting an astonishing retail price range'

Having started out on market stalls and raising the funds for a Bridal shop, my passion for all things Bridal started.

Listening to each and every bride over the years looking for something different, more versatile my design background was eager to get started and finally design a range of gowns vintage, boho chic that could be adapted to the original bride. 

With a retail price point of between £500-£650 we aimed for an affordable brand so our brides can enjoy a beautiful gown without spending the earth.

Change the sleeves, gown length, style tops and add colour make our designs your own, we want our brides to feel they have chosen the gown of their dreams!!!

Very near to the start of the launch our designer and owner Hana found her Grandmother to be very poorly and needing end of life care, as a tribute she set her sights on creating her dream, with her Grandparents love as the inspiration, the Myra gown
column23:
her wedding gown inspired Hana to redesign and to rework the 'old' to make the new vintage.
Hana's Grandmother and her wedding gown will live on through the Myra gown, her ever lasting legacy will be a Brides dream gown, their own treasured heirloom.

column4: >Your funding will help to achieve the growth plans needed for our next steps and help Pearlarose launch new upcoming collections along side their core collection, attend bridal trade fairs to keep showcasing their gowns and grow our stockists, so our gowns can be  seen and enjoyed by more brides to be in different countries around the world.

column1: Now stocked in five bridal shops, one in Southern Ireland and four in England, we are growing at an unbelievable rate and cannot wait to expand and give more Brides to be their happy ever after.
Our aim is to become a well known brand selling beautiful gowns with out the high price tag ,

Win - Win

 

With this campaing we seek to develop our ""Shared Spaces of Knowledge"" program with other artisans communities around Peru and lunch more products full of art and culture. For this, we need around 3,000 dollars.
Therefore, we decided to give you the chance to get three kind of products of our textile line:
• Camara straps: Iconography based on Nazca's culture.
• Saddle bag: Iconography based on Peruvian's corn.
All of our products use original leather, are 100% handmade, using the pedal loom technique, and colored with eco-friendly inks (textile).
Our products take time to be make. You will have and original and beautiful piece of work made by hand in around 50 days.

column5:
>I started Lush Bazaar to bring quality handmade fusion-fashion from India to the fashion hungry market in the United States of America. The brand, Lush Bazaar, reflects the themes behind our vision: bold, unique, fusion and full of inspiration.

Each intricate, handmade product is designed with the intention to fuse the western and eastern fashion in a subtle and contemporary way. Our products blend cosmopolitan styles with rustic materials for an urban chic look. Quality and comfort are our unwavering tenants - Every Lush Bazaar item is handmade by women who pour in their individual creativity, passion, and love into each beautiful product. The love (products) is then sent to the USA, where local single mothers, and disadvantaged women add on to the story, distributing the products, via e-commerce, and our bazaar on wheels. Each product has a story to tell, a story of a woman helping another women, empowering their lives, and future, and spreading the beauty of their hard work-- Inspiring others.

Lush Bazaar wants to change the fashion industry, and make a positive change in gender inequality. Our focus is in empowering our employees, who are women of disadvantaged backgrounds . Empowering them to better their lives, and families. With doing so we know our products, and their stories will inspire our consumers to shop, and spread the Lush Bazaar story- Inspiring others.

column1:
•305.2 Million women in India do not have jobs.

•Women who work in sweatshops make $68 a month. Working up to 80 hours a week.
•597,610 households in Pennsylvania are headed by women.
•180,478 households in Pennsylvania live below the poverty level.

Gender Inequality is a HUGE problem that is facing our world, and needs to be changed. Our Mission- Changing it. 

Our solution to the exploitation and low wages paid to women is a fashion line that puts Women first, and profit second. It is a fashion line that is inspired BY women, purchased BY or FOR women and benefits WOMEN globally.

I've visited many fair trade stores across the US and what I realized is that I wouldn't wear most of the clothing that is out there. The majority of fair-trade clothing options are not designed for the modern, trendy woman who wants the vibrant colors of the East melded with the classic and flattering styles of the West. Our products blend cosmopolitan styles with rustic materials for an urban chic look. Our products will appeal to fashion minded shoppers, or anyone who believes in doing good.
I believe that TOGETHER we are Lush Bazaar, and I know I can't do this alone. I’m raising $16,200 in seed funding to make Lush Bazaar's long-term vision a success!
Funding from this campaign will provide the seed funding for Lush Bazaar to have a positive impact in five primary ways:
•Provide training to underprivileged women in India to employment in US and India.
•Develop and implement production costs in India, and pay for start-up costs related to these partnerships (equipment, fabric, etc)
•Partner directly with artisans creating the fabric for our clothing. We desire to source fabric for the 2017 collection from ethical sources. (

column3: empowering all women. The more we raise/sell, the more women we can hire! The more products we can have.

column1: •Investing in a used step van truck, to restore and refurbish for a beautiful, and unique fashion truck.
With the investment raised, Lush Bazaar will be able to fully launch it’s 2017 Collection &
column2: have the first fashion truck in Lancaster, Pennsylvania.

column1:
•And YOU won't go away empty handed!! We have some great perks for you.

•Every backer will receive, a hand written thank you note from the Lush Bazaar team. A special
column2: >Lush Bazaar badge to add to your social media.
column3:
>Updates about Lush Bazaar. Including special perks for how much you -- back us up.  

•We appreciate your kindness. Your support in our Lush Bazaar campaign will make a positive difference.•

It’s pretty simple. Our vision for Lush Bazaar is to show the world the power of women working together.

column1: With thriving wage jobs for underprivileged women we can make a positive impact in their lives, and families. Which in return will make a positive impact in their local community. We chose a fashion boutique, because we want to be able to spread the message of socially conscious clothing, as well as the many stories of empowerment from our employees. Our customers will not only have a unique shopping experience, but a shopping experience that will inspire them.
column3:
/>

I plan on having a 2017 Lush Bazaar collection ready by March 2017. I believe that our products will be ready for the truck and our e-commerce site by early April. There may be hiccups we face in the beginning of this process, and I ask you to please be patient with our team, as we go through our stage of production. Every product is handmade and needs human resource to make it happen. So please be patient as we try and perfect Lush Bazaar, and every product. Thank You!  

Throughout the manufacturing process we will be updating our backers regularly and keep them posted on our progress.

Duty/VAT charges: If you live outside of the US, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges.

There are a few primary ways you can help!

column1: •INVEST in our campaign at any level to receive our many perks.
•INVEST in our campaign even if you don't want an incentive, but because you are excited about our vision!
•SHARE this campaign with your friends and family on your Facebook page and via email -- Indiegogo makes it really easy for you!
•SIGN UP for our email list at www.lushbazaar.com
•FOLLOW us on Instagram @lushbazaar
column8: >I love designing, and wearing beautiful clothing,  but what I love even more than those two things combined - helping others, especially women. I'm not a feminist, I'm just a woman who believes in the strength, and beauty of ALL women, that many times is overlooked, or under-appreciated.
column10:
>My Grandmother once told me that I could do anything I put my heart to, and I believed her. I've put my whole heart into Lush Bazaar, because I know the positive difference this fashion label will have in women's lives, connecting empowering,  and inspiring. Everybody needs that one person who believes in them, I had my grandmother, and I hope I can be that one person for women who do not have anyone. 

If you would like to reach me, feel free to email me at timbrel@lushbazaar.com 

I would love to hear from you!

column2: >“ I believe in strong women, because I am one.”
column12:
>This crowdfunding campaign is part of The Great Social Enterprise Pitch, a friendly competition facilitated by ASSETS and the Lancaster County Community Foundation. The Pitch consists of social enterprise ideas based in Central Pennsylvania. A Social Enterprise is a market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or environmental problem through its business activities.  Social enterprises focus on a trip bottom line:  people, planet, and profit.  Upon completion of the Crowdfunding phase of the competition, 5 ideas will be chosen to move on to the Live Pitch, during which the contestants will present their ideas to a panel of judges, with winners receiving a package of cash and pro-bono prizes. In 2015, winners received over $50,000 in cash and pro-bono prizes.

Please visit
column14: e=35befb239a"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">www.lancasterpitch.com for more information.  To access to the crowdfunding sites of all participating social enterprise ideas, click here:
column16:
e=35befb239a"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">https://www.indiegogo.com/partners/SocialEnterprisePitch.

","I started Lush Bazaar to bring quality handmade fusion-fashion from India to the fashion hungry market in the United States of America. The brand, Lush Bazaar, reflects the themes behind our vision: bold, unique, fusion and full of inspiration.Each intricate, handmade product is designed with the intention to fuse the western and eastern fashion in a subtle and contemporary way. Our products blend cosmopolitan styles with rustic materials for an urban chic look. Quality and comfort are our unwavering tenants - Every Lush Bazaar item is handmade by women who pour in their individual creativity, passion, and love into each beautiful product. The love (products) is then sent to the USA, where local single mothers, and disadvantaged women add on to the story, distributing the products, via e-commerce, and our bazaar on wheels. Each product has a story to tell, a story of a woman helping another women, empowering their lives, and future, and spreading the beauty of their hard work-- Inspiring others.Lush Bazaar wants to change the fashion industry, and make a positive change in gender inequality. Our focus is in empowering our employees, who are women of disadvantaged backgrounds . Empowering them to better their lives, and families. With doing so we know our products, and their stories will inspire our consumers to shop, and spread the Lush Bazaar story- Inspiring others.

column1: •305.2 Million women in India do not have jobs.•Women who work in sweatshops make $68 a month. Working up to 80 hours a week.
•597,610 households in Pennsylvania are headed by women.
•180,478 households in Pennsylvania live below the poverty level.

Gender Inequality is a HUGE problem that is facing our world, and needs to be changed. Our Mission- Changing it. Our solution to the exploitation and low wages paid to women is a fashion line that puts Women first, and profit second. It is a fashion line that is inspired BY women, purchased BY or FOR women and benefits WOMEN globally.

I've visited many fair trade stores across the US and what I realized is that I wouldn't wear most of the clothing that is out there. The majority of fair-trade clothing options are not designed for the modern, trendy woman who wants the vibrant colors of the East melded with the classic and flattering styles of the West. Our products blend cosmopolitan styles with rustic materials for an urban chic look. Our products will appeal to fashion minded shoppers, or anyone who believes in doing good.
I believe that TOGETHER we are Lush Bazaar, and I know I can't do this alone. I’m raising $16,200 in seed funding to make Lush Bazaar's long-term vision a success!
Funding from this campaign will provide the seed funding for Lush Bazaar to have a positive impact in five primary ways:
•Provide training to underprivileged women in India to employment in US and India.
•Develop and implement production costs in India, and pay for start-up costs related to these partnerships (equipment, fabric, etc)
•Partner directly with artisans creating the fabric for our clothing. We desire to source fabric for the 2017 collection from ethical sources. (
•Go into full production (in USA & India)——providing a living wage & empowering all women. The more we raise/sell, the more women we can hire! The more products we can have.
•Investing in a used step van truck, to restore and refurbish for a beautiful, and unique fashion truck.
With the investment raised, Lush Bazaar will be able to fully launch it’s 2017 Collection & have the first fashion truck in Lancaster, Pennsylvania.

•And YOU won't go away empty handed!! We have some great perks for you.•Every backer will receive, a hand written thank you note from the Lush Bazaar team. A special Lush Bazaar badge to add to your social media. Updates about Lush Bazaar. Including special perks for how much you -- back us up.  •We appreciate your kindness. For the on-the-go Woman: Luxury Lash Mask™

Introducing The Luxury Lash Mask™ the ultimate beauty product for women who wear false eyelashes.  We have designed a luxurious mask that will protect your lashes while you sleep. The Lash Mask solves every woman's problem with sleeping in false lashes, like no more removing them before bedtime, protecting the  delicate shape, and preserving the life of the lashes.
Sleep in your lashes! YES, you can NOW sleep in your lashes. No need to re-apply each morning!
If you can't contribute you can still help us by sharing our Campaign on your social media pages!
Thank you so much for your support!

We have brought you amazing luxury low top sneakers to help redefine how you do smart and smart casual. The Iven Alger leather sneakers are smart enough for your office wears and cool enough for your denims and tracksuits while staying comfortable all day.

              

            

Who We Are

We are an emerging fashion brand. We are starting to build our base in London where we will be giving a modern approach to menswear with focus on fit, comfort, style and quality. We understand too well that we are in an over saturated and very capital intensive industry, our knowledge of menswear and other fashion items are what put us in a position of opportunity thanks to all our backers, fashion bloggers, friends and social media followers.

We have spent the past few years working with fashion brands and private clients on image consultancy through our parent company, FOS Image UK, an image consulting firm working with men and businesses, and we think that:
• Men don't always need dress shoes to dress up or down
• They often want something that makes them look cooler when they are casually and smartly dressed in suits or denims.
<li>They want a pair of shoes, especially sneakers, that are not overbearing with designs and won't hurt their feet
column2: something classic, versatile and which speaks to them.

column1:
How The Iven Alger Brand Started

We started building a fashion brand that offers what men really want in their shoes by creating the Iven Alger brand via brand naming process. We then came up with some sketches and sent these out to friends, fashion critics, former fashion teachers and clients who might be interested in our shoes.

 

Why Crowdfund?

We all know how expensive shoe manufacturing is. As an emerging brand, we think that in order to grow, we need an injection of cash. Banks are not interested in lending to small businesses whose works are still in prototype stage. So, we chose crowdfunding. A platform like Indiegogo is a good place for us to raise money for our business idea. Currently, we have one design that has been prototyped in black and brown colors. They are the low cap toe sneakers displayed on this campaign page. We need to raise £20,000 to get our first few hundreds of sneakers into production and ship in the Spring of 2017.

 

What You Get?

We have set up our campaign like a pre order system. For instance, if you give us an earlier pledge by pre ordering our sneakers, you get a bigger discount of what the retail price will be after the campaign. If you pledge £5, we will mention you in our Thank You advert on Facebook. £25 will get you one of our limited Vanite dad hats. We will also publish the names of those who pre order our sneakers on our website as our founding backers with a Vanite dad hat going to those from the £163 per pair price ranges. So, it is a win-win situation. You get great perks and we get funds to manufacture our first range of smart, luxury sneakers.

 

The Iven Alger Luxury Sneakers

That men want something that makes them look cooler doesn't mean they don't want a bit of luxury added to their shoes. So what we did was to research and come up with designs that can make use of mid range shoe materials that will in turn make our collection of shoes elegant, wearable and stylish.

Italy has a good reputation for top quality leather shoes and a good percentage of our clients associate themselves with Italian-made shoes, be it sneakers or dress shoes. Based on this, we went on to create designs that have a combination of British elegance and Italian craftsmanship. Take a look at our debut sneakers collection and you will find this combination in them.

       

     

Production

We are not just keen about starting a business or running an Indiegogo campaign, we want to make sure we run the production of a top quality shoe brand that our esteemed customers can always put their money on and also make our backers proud of us as an emerging brand. We are handing the production of this debut collection to reputable family-run shoe factory in Le Marche, Italy. They have been making shoes for old and new brands for generations and now, we have both come up with a classic collection of men's sneakers that are both stylish and comfortable.

Sneakers Description

Designed in London and handmade in Italy, Iven Alger luxury leather sneakers have been designed and fitted with a contrasting white colored (or black matching) sole with hand-sewn thread details on the heel tab and towards the cap toe. Made with top quality Italian leather (calf skin), the sneakers have a sheep skin lining and a soft cushioned foot bed for ultimate comfort and fit.

             

 

Sneaker Details

Size Chart

This size chart below is only a guide on men's shoes. It is not intended to confuse, remember that there is no strict rule as to what the size chart must look. 

                        

 

Risks and Challenges

Our primary challenge has been to get our shoes out there so that people can know about them. We have only been in the industry for few years, but we have been quick to learn what the pitfalls are and how brands before us have overcome them. No doubt, creating and delivering a new product has been a tough process. Raising an initial capital to run our first production is another thing, and this has to meet factory minimum quantities for us to deliver quality shoes. We have identified the delays and setbacks often associated with manufacturing but because we have engaged a top Italian shoe manufacturer, we have made good efforts to reduce these setbacks. We will always deliver but the more support you give us, the better we are to get started. 

 

FAQs

When Can I pre order?

Pre order for our leather sneakers can be made through Indiegogo. Campaigns will run for thirty five days from when it goes live. After the campaign, they will sell at retail price on our website.

When will product ship?

We will make sure we ship all orders as soon as they are ready. This will be in April, 2017. Meanwhile, customers who have pre ordered the sneakers will be sent regular updates on the progresses made so far.

Delivery fees on pre order?

We offer free worldwide delivery on all pre orders made on Indiegogo. But bear in mind that import fees or any other carrier fees are not included. Import taxes are applied by each country's customs regulations.

Where are the shoes made?

Our luxury leather sneakers are designed at our London base by one of the best fashion illustrators you can find around London. They are then handmade in Italy.

What if the design or specification changes?

Usually, prototype precedes the final production of a product. So, it is possible that there could be a slight change to the specification and design. As a luxury fashion brand, we will always try to stick to the prototype we show our customers in the final production. Where we introduce a change in design or specification, it will be a slight one and we will only do so to further enhance the quality and durability of the product. Customers who have pre ordered these products will also be informed of any changes to the product’s specification or design through email.  

 

Have A Question?

If you have any question for us, email us here info@ivenalger.co.uk

 

Other Ways To Help?

If you like the Iven Alger brand,  you can like our Facebook page here: www.facebook.com/IVENALGER

If you like this campaign and love what we want to achieve with it, kindly share it with your friends and family by using the Indiegogo share tools.

 

Thank you for your support.

column2:
THE IMPACT by the initiator Nina Grünfeld

The idea for the Coexista awareness bracelet came to me as I made my last film about the Jewish children’s home in Oslo during WW2. Coexista.com is my response to the terror that has taken place the last years. We live in a more unstable world and the media tends to scare us, but I want to emphasize on the constructive and positive forces. When I travel to screen my films and hold lecturers I meet many people with healthy values and attitudes. Most people are decent and knows right from wrong. They just don’t always get the opportunity to show it. That is why I have made a tool named Coexista. Coexista is an attitude tool shaped in a bracelet that reminds you about your values and helps you show your opinion, rejecting anti-Semitism, islamophobia and extremism.

Now I am asking you to help me go international. We just launched the French site and I want to translate it into Spanish and German. And wouldn’t it be great with Arabic and Hebrew?

By buying Coexista jewelleries as holiday gifts for your family and friends you help me spread the message and to finance the development and growth of the charity work. 

Read more about the story and impact here on Coexista's homepage.

 

WHY SUPPORT US?

column1: • You get to select from one of the awesome perks below depending on the amount of your contribution.
• We love bracelets and you probably do too.

• Coexista is the perfect gift for confirmations and birthdays, for Christmas, Hanukkah, or Ramadan - or simply as a meaningful appreciation. The jewelry comes with a tag that explains the concept, packed in a delicate jewelry bag made out of resirculated cotton. Coexista is a cool and elegant gift that fits all genders and all ages. Or what about a gift for yourself?

• When you wear Coexista jewelry, you show that you reject Islamophobia, anti-Semitism, and growing extremism. You take a stand and you show that you wish for a peaceful coexistence. As an added bonus, you get to dress up with a beautiful piece of jewelry.
• Proceeds go to charitable purposes consistent with Coexista’s message.

WHAT WE NEED 

The Coexista bracelets and anklets are in production and has been successfully for a year. We sell them through our webshop and a handful Oslo based retail stores, such as the souvenir shop at the Alfred Nobel’s Peace Centre.

For 20.000 $ we can translate the website into German, Spanish, Arabic and Hebrew. At the moment it is in English, French and Norwegian. We can also do the necessary upgrading of the software that is called for. We wish to spend some of the money on reaching out, getting the message through by contacting the media and work on the public attention. 

For another 15.000 $ we wish to launch a worldwide competition where young creative designers and jewellers can send in their creations as suggestions for our next Coexista-collection. Three winners will get their design produced. We will celebrate the winners and their designs at a launch that we wish to arrange in cooperation with The Alfred Nobel Peace Centre in Oslo, whom we have worked successfully together with earlier. 

 

WHAT YOU GET 

Depending on what perk you choose you will get one or several Coexista bracelets. The bracelets are already produced and ready to send out. 

As a donator you will be kept posted on the development of Coexista through Indiegogo and the Coexista newsletter.

This campaign is a flexible funding as our products are already in production. Whatever we will receive from this campaign will help us reach our next goal. With your participation and support we will reach our goal sooner rather than later.

Please have a look at the Coexista webshop  and see the elegant, beautiful and meaningful bracelets that shows your awareness and opinion.

 

Donate 9 $

and receive a link to the film “Nina’s Children” telling the story about the Jewish children’s home in Oslo during WW2. It was while making this film that the idea of Coexista.com was conceived. The film has English subtitles.

 

Donate 39 $ 

and receive a beautiful silver or gold-plated Coexista-simple-bracelet. The bracelet shows the three symbols
column2:
the Christian cross, the Jewish star of David and the Islamic half moon Hilal.

 

Donate 99 $ 

and receive two beautiful Coexista bracelets, one Burgundy with gold plated coins and one Grey with silver coins. The three coins show the symbols
column3:
the Christian cross, the Jewish star of David and the Islamic half moon Hilal.

 

Donate 129 $ 

and receive three beautiful Coexista bracelets, one Burgundy with gold plated coins and one Grey with silver coins. The three coins show the symbols
column4:
the Christian cross, the Jewish star of David and the Islamic half moon Hilal.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t donate or get a perk you can help us by spreading the message. A YouTube film is available on https://youtu.be/LQAPTWGJK2Y Please copy the link and post it on your social medias.

 

WHO WE ARE

The initiator behind Coexista.com is the filmmaker and author Nina Grünfeld. Along with her is the Coexista’s ethical board with the following members: philosopher Henrik Syse, Deputy Director of Immigration Birgitte Lange and the initiators behind Circle of peace Zeeshan Abdullah and Hajrah Arshad. You can read more about them here.

","THE STORY & THE IMPACT by the initiator Nina GrünfeldThe idea for the Coexista awareness bracelet came to me as I made my last film about the Jewish children’s home in Oslo during WW2. Coexista.com is my response to the terror that has taken place the last years. We live in a more unstable world and the media tends to scare us, but I want to emphasize on the constructive and positive forces. When I travel to screen my films and hold lecturers I meet many people with healthy values and attitudes. Most people are decent and knows right from wrong. They just don’t always get the opportunity to show it. That is why I have made a tool named Coexista. Coexista is an attitude tool shaped in a bracelet that reminds you about your values and helps you show your opinion, rejecting anti-Semitism, islamophobia and extremism.Now I am asking you to help me go international. We just launched the French site and I want to translate it into Spanish and German. And wouldn’t it be great with Arabic and Hebrew?By buying Coexista jewelleries as holiday gifts for your family and friends you help me spread the message and to finance the development and growth of the charity work. Read more about the story and impact here on Coexista's homepage. WHY SUPPORT US?

column1: You get to select from one of the awesome perks below depending on the amount of your contribution.
We love bracelets and you probably do too.

Coexista is the perfect gift for confirmations and birthdays, for Christmas, Hanukkah, or Ramadan - or simply as a meaningful appreciation. The jewelry comes with a tag that explains the concept, packed in a delicate jewelry bag made out of resirculated cotton. Coexista is a cool and elegant gift that fits all genders and all ages. Or what about a gift for yourself?

When you wear Coexista jewelry, you show that you reject Islamophobia, anti-Semitism, and growing extremism. You take a stand and you show that you wish for a peaceful coexistence. As an added bonus, you get to dress up with a beautiful piece of jewelry.
Proceeds go to charitable purposes consistent with Coexista’s message.

WHAT WE NEED The Coexista bracelets and anklets are in production and has been successfully for a year. We sell them through our webshop and a handful Oslo based retail stores, such as the souvenir shop at the Alfred Nobel’s Peace Centre.For 20.000 $ we can translate the website into German, Spanish, Arabic and Hebrew. At the moment it is in English, French and Norwegian. We can also do the necessary upgrading of the software that is called for. We wish to spend some of the money on reaching out, getting the message through by contacting the media and work on the public attention. For another 15.000 $ we wish to launch a worldwide competition where young creative designers and jewellers can send in their creations as suggestions for our next Coexista-collection. Three winners will get their design produced. We will celebrate the winners and their designs at a launch that we wish to arrange in cooperation with The Alfred Nobel Peace Centre in Oslo, whom we have worked successfully together with earlier.  WHAT YOU GET Depending on what perk you choose you will get one or several Coexista bracelets. The bracelets are already produced and ready to send out. As a donator you will be kept posted on the development of Coexista through Indiegogo and the Coexista newsletter.This campaign is a flexible funding as our products are already in production. Whatever we will receive from this campaign will help us reach our next goal. With your participation and support we will reach our goal sooner rather than later.Please have a look at the Coexista webshop  and see the elegant, beautiful and meaningful bracelets that shows your awareness and opinion. Donate 9 $and receive a link to the film “Nina’s Children” telling the story about the Jewish children’s home in Oslo during WW2. It was while making this film that the idea of Coexista.com was conceived. The film has English subtitles. Donate 39 $ and receive a beautiful silver or gold-plated Coexista-simple-bracelet. The bracelet shows the three symbols
column2: the Christian cross, the Jewish star of David and the Islamic half moon Hilal. Donate 99 $ and receive two beautiful Coexista bracelets, one Burgundy with gold plated coins and one Grey with silver coins. The three coins show the symbols
column3: the Christian cross, the Jewish star of David and the Islamic half moon Hilal. Donate 129 $ and receive three beautiful Coexista bracelets, one Burgundy with gold plated coins and one Grey with silver coins. The three coins show the symbols
column4: the Christian cross, the Jewish star of David and the Islamic half moon Hilal. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPIf you can’t donate or get a perk you can help us by spreading the message. A YouTube film is available on https://youtu.be/LQAPTWGJK2Y Please copy the link and post it on your social medias. WHO WE AREThe initiator behind Coexista.com is the filmmaker and author Nina Grünfeld. Along with her is the Coexista’s ethical board with the following members: philosopher Henrik Syse, Deputy Director of Immigration Birgitte Lange and the initiators behind Circle of peace Zeeshan Abdullah and Hajrah Arshad. You can read more about them here.",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: Both the use of natural materials and simple implementation were primary goals while designing these spectacles. The frame is constructed from plywood made from the wood of local tree species. The outer layer of the profile is walnut, while the inner layers and the temples are made of ash. The special glue used to secure the layers provides enough flexibility for the lenses to be snapped into place at room temperature.While designing these spectacles, it is important that the hinges be manufactured locally and in the simplest way possible. In contrast to traditional hinges, the temples of these spectacles must be rotated 170 degrees inward to close them. The rotation is made possible by specially placed notches on the temples, wooden pins and by a spring-like wooden piece hidden in the frame.

The spring-like movement of the hinges is inspired by the spring mechanism of pocketknives. This springing sensation is caused by the tension that develops at the base of the temple, and is supported by the flexibility and wear resistance of the layered pieces. The use of new technology and renewable, top-quality materials make this frame merely 11g, which provides comfort for the wearer. The hand polished wooden frame highlights the elegance and diversity of natural materials, giving these spectacles further aesthetic value.

We, the people behind Axis would like to introduce our new line of sunglasses to you. Our company was funded in 2015 in order to bring innovation into the world of glasses and to offer our customers unique, quality products. Our first concept work has already been rewarded with one of the industry's most prestigious awards, so now it's your turn to become the proud owner of a 'Red Dot' award winning product.

Thank you for choosing our product! We are proud to welcome you to the Axis family, and we hope that you will choose us next time as well, when you are looking for a new and unique pair of glasses. Should you have any questions or complaints about our product, please write us a message at axisspectacles@gmail.com, we are happy to help you!

Manufacturing Delays,
While we anticipate no manufacturing issues, there is always a chance of delays for various reasons. If such a delay were to occur, you would still receive your pair of Axis Wooden Spectacles just a little bit later than expected.
If you choose not to fund our project, you can still help us reach our goal by sharing our project on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter ...etc.

Don't let the simplicity of The Clique 2 deceive you. It is designed to function smoothly, without effort, without repair or replacement. Compare our wallet with other typical designs that exist, and you will discover that simplicity is much better.
How The Clique 2 is different from the rest
-NO elastic bands or O-rings that will eventually weaken and break, requiring an exact replacement to be found. No need to keep extra supplies just to be sure you wallet will work the next day.

-NO messing with constantly fighting the stretch tension of elastic or O-rings to try to insert or access your cards and bills. You don't need to practice and practice to get just the ""right"" finger techniques to open the wallet and avoid being embarrassed at the checkout counter.

-NO more dealing with protruding rubber O-rings, elastics or rubber bands that are difficult to smoothly slide into your jean or carry bag pockets. The rubbery surfaces tend to grip onto fabric while inserting or taking out the wallet. This is a daily action which quickly becomes frustrating.

-NO screws that will come unscrewed and be lost as has been reported with other wallet designs. Once the tiny screw is lost, where do you find a replacement? Do you need to keep a small jar of screws somewhere at home ""just in case""?

Designing a wallet from a single piece of aluminum was much harder than creating a wallet assembled from multiple parts. However, in order to avoid the issues listed above, we found it was absolutely necessary. As a result, using The Clique 2 is a smooth and pleasant experience.
“Simple can be harder than complex: You have to work hard to get your thinking clean to make it simple. But it’s worth it in the end because once you get there, you can move mountains.”

Creating the clique 2 wasn't an easy task. It was a meticulous process that involved developing and 3D printing multiple prototypes until we had a product we could stand behind. This obsession all began from the dissatisfaction for a wallet that didn't fit our lifestyles. We found ourselves carrying big leather wallets to hold our credit, gift and ID cards. However, due to the growing convenience of credit cards, the cash compartment was typically unused. This meant that we were utilizing only a small fraction of the wallet
column2: making it an extremely bulky solution.

column1: Size comparison (Clique 2 on the left and traditional wallet on the right)

Not only that, the traditional wallet didn't store the cards conveniently. We would often have to take all the cards out and sort through them to find the one we needed. This was simply not good enough.
With The Clique 2 we have managed to solve these issues. We have created a beautiful slim wallet that conveniently and securely stores numerous cards, while also allowing for easy access.
Load all your cards at once. (Holds up to 8 cards, 7 with a bill)
The side walls will flex open and retract once the cards are fully inserted
Release and load the top card with ease.
Once loaded, your cards are safe and sound.
When a card is inserted, The Clique 2 will generate a clicking sound
column2: assuring you the card is secure.

column1: Transform The Clique 2 into a phone kickstand with the assistance of one of your cards.
Prop up your phone and enjoy hands-free viewing
We designed The Clique 2 with a universal appeal. Perfect for every lifestyle.

An integral part of our objective was creating a structurally sound wallet. So instead of having to rely on fasteners or screws to assemble The Clique 2, we decided to machine it from a single block of aluminum. This was very challenging, because we needed to have walls that flexed but did not bend. So after many software and real world testings, we developed a unique design. One which distributes the stress on the sidewalls into four different regions instead of one. This allows the aluminum to not bend past its threshold and to retain its flexibility.

The Clique 2 is machined from aluminum 6061, which is corrosion resistant. This material is often used for the fabrication of aircraft components and yacht structures. Aluminum 6061 is also light and provides extraordinary strength, which we are confident will suit your demands.

Once machined, The Clique 2 is then bead blasted and sent off to get anodized. The anodizing process is completed by immersing The Clique 2 in an acid electrolyte bath and running a current through the medium. This electrochemical process adds color, durability, and an anodic oxide coat. The result is a beautiful long lasting finish.
Available in Titanium Grey or Carbon Black

Grand Valor was started by two friends, Jose Ortiz (Mechanical Engineer), and Rafael Jimenez (Electrical Engineer). Both being engineers, we would constantly discuss how to improve items that we used often. On one particular day, we had a discussion about the ways we could redesign and improve the wallet. We really connected with this concept and after several months of research and development The Clique 2 was born.

Having The Clique 2 manufactured requires a machinist, anodizer, and laser engraver. When having multiple process for production, we have to depend on many people for a smooth operation. To try to mitigate any delays, we have met with several different experts in the respective industries, and selected the most professional and qualified people. Having said that, we have also allocated time for any possible delays that could occur in our manufacturing chain. Essentially, we have embedded a cushion of time for each process when calculating our delivery times.

I was raised in Southern California where I was immersed in a world of creativity. From following my older sister to dance class, spending summers in my father's photography studio, to watching my mother paint it always seemed I was destined to travel a creative path. At the age of ten I spent the summer learning the artisan tradition of bead weaving from a family friend Frank ""Frankie"" Perez. Frankie was an old soul and authentic to his core. I thought he was the coolest and even double stacked rings on my fingers to imitate him. Good thing no photographs exist of those days as I never really pulled it off like he did. :) He made his own jewelry, tumbled and cut his own stones, worked with metal and was a master bead weaver working on his handmade loom. It was this last artisan tradition that I spent much of my summer learning.

Upon Frank's passing, while I was still attending New York University, Frank's wife handed down his loom to me. I was honored to be given his hand made loom but I was on a path to be a professional dancer... or so I thought. While I worked on a custom-order basis I did not fully realize the vision for Lock and Key for another fifteen years. 

After spending over a decade as a professional dancer, working in the television and theatre industries, I found myself injured and in the middle of a ""Who am I Anyway"" moment. My skills at hand sewing, scenic and costume design helped land me a job, and the beginning of a new career, in the New York fashion industry working for some of the top designers in the world. After traveling back to Los Angeles and continuing to gain invaluable experience I settled down, with my wife and toddler son, in Nashville where Lock and Key found its roots. 

When I am not on the loom I am getting my hands and feet dirty, creatively speaking, when ever possible. From graphic and textile design to modern, tap, classical ballet and yoga my mind and body are always on the go. 

The Designs:

Lock and Key brings a touch of modern eclecticism and international cool to each collection. By fusing Native American beading, I am some what cetain frankie was Hopi Indian, with classic ball-and-chain Lock and Key connects the past with the present. Each piece is hand beaded and/or loomed with the ball-and-chain interweaving with the beading seamlessly. I also work with my Grandftaher's clay tools hand scultping bronze and Sterling silver metal clay pendants. It is an amazing process which I can not wait to share with you further.
Each collection is seasonal and researching the semi-precious stones is one aspect of the process I cherish. Being a proud bolo tie wearer and rock tumbler as a kid I feel I have come full tumble. :)
Each style has been named after a notable person in history with a bit of intrigue bringing even more depth to each piece of jewelry. With an iconic lock charm finishing off each Lock &
column2: Key piece, the jewelry urges wearers to continue the story sharing the piece's as well as a bit of their own.

column1: I have been growing Lock and Key for almost three years now. I have seen tremendous growth over those three years by developing a unique, artisan design aesthetic and then targeting my core consumer through multiple distribution channels. I am now at the intersection where I am ready to grow bigger, capture the momentum that I have built and create a fully sustainable business for my family and my team. That I can not do with out your help.

I attend local festivals, up to twelve a year, where I sell directly to consumers. I have begun the shift to more juried art shows which are harder to get into and generally attract more serious buyers then the local art festival. I have already had successful shows in Nashville and Knoxville TN.

Your funding will allow me to apply for additional juried art shows for the 2018 fiscal year. There are amazing art shows around the country and your support will allow me to take the risk in new cities and in front of new audiences. For the second half of 2017 I am already traveling to both Washington D.C. and Louisville KY and your funding will off set travel costs, inventory needs, insurance and space fees to name a few.
I launched my website http://www.lockandkeydesign.com in early 2016. I have seen some success but I am missing the opportunity to capture the on-line consumer.
Your funding will allow me to produce inventory just for the website. I will also invest in on line marketing as well as SEO optimization.

I have approached key boutiques in the Nashville area and have nurtured amazing relationships with 8 boutiques so far. I work with them individually to create local partnerships. As a local Nashville art jeweler these boutiques are key to my business.

I attended my first wholesale trade show in Atlanta this past June with great response and after successful follow up great sales. I am excited to be expanding this Fall to Atlanta, Hilton Head and Charlotte-NC to name a few.

I need to continue the momentum and return to Atlanta in October for the SP 18 market and 2018 markets. These shows are extremely expensive and to not only solidify new accounts but grow new retailers will need marketing dollars as well to reach out for pre-sales.

Many viewing my collection in Atlanta suggested I also attend the Dallas market. With a great high end clientele it can be a key market for Lock and Key. Your funding will help me attend my first wholesale market in Dallas in 2018.

I am always trying to think outside the box. From private trunk shows, new partnerships and pop up events I am always trying to reach my consumers in new ways. I am excited to announce I will be featured in the August issue of Nashville Arts Magazine.
All of the above have expenses and I want to continue to do new events as consumers attention needs to be captured by excited, outside the box experiences.
As the Owner, Designer, Marketing and Sales Director and all around Maker and Shaker it is time to reach out to you and ask to help me take the next step. 2017 has been a big year so far.

And don't forget about 2018...  new national markets, new juried art shows which will mean expanding my team to include additional production help because with each new market there will be new orders, more raw materials and faster hands.
• I need $15,000 in order to take the next steps needed to grow my small business.
• I have really fun and amazing EXCLUSIVE perks to thank you for supporting my journey.

I am grateful to each and every one of you. I want you to know that my goals listed above are very intentional and have been thoughtfully decided upon from the learnings I have gained over the past three years of sweat equity I have invested into Lock and Key. This has taught me, amongst many other things, to mitigate as much risk as possible and always, ALWAYS be able to be flexible so if something is not working STOP and move forward with anew plan.

In addition I was accepted into a small business training course called Periscope through the Arts and Business Council of Nashville. Not only will I will leave a stronger small business owner but I will be partnered with a business mentor to continue my growth.

Because I don't know how many orders I will get from this campaign, I am putting an estimated ship date of October on all orders to give myself a little extra time to produce everything. While realistically I will be able to get the perks not hand made by myself out earlier, there is always a possibility of an overwhelming response and I want to ensure that I can get everyone taken care of by the date I have promised.
Lastly I have been training part time employees and interns my craft. I am ready to offer them more hours/pay to meet  the production growth and your funding will allow this to happen.
You can support my campaign by getting the word out, letting people know about a small artisan business and help #supportsmall.
Thank you for supporting a small business and making it possible for this artist to work closer to becoming a sustainable business for his family.
$10 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- Just Cuz: Grateful for your support
$25 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- Flair Plz: 1"" pin set
$40 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- It's All in the Journal- For all of your little secrets:
$50 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- Slitherin' Tee: Super soft heather gray t-shirt designed just for the campaign.
$85 Coast Away- natural agate slices: Comes in a pair

$85 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- All Zipped Up and Ready to Go: A zipper bag for everything you need for an adventure. Gold metallic graphic printed on a black canvas bag, Chunky gold zipper and champagne satin lining details. Dimensions 9""x6.5""

$125 A Ring for the Ages: Custom made antique bronze sculpted ring. 1/2"" by 3/4"" this new classic ring can be worn with anything. Textured with a mold I made from a red oak tree in my backyard the signet style ring seamlessly blends to contrasting materials wood and metal. Something Tolkien would be proud of.
$125 Studded: A perfect pair of studs for any occasion. Just enough sparkle. Each pair are unique in color due to the natural stone variances. 3/4"" in diameter
$225 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE: A Ring For Cocktailing In. LIMITED EDITION and ONE OF A KIND
Examples of the ring with each cabochon being about 1"" a bold statement indeed. Wrapped in bronze and hand sculpted to your specific size.
As of 8/31/17 #s 1, 2 and 5 available.

$350 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE: A Sea of Aquamarine. One of a kind designed necklace using faceted aquamarine beads and a secretly designed pendant. Option to include a piece off your own in the necklace deign. LIMITED EDITION and ONE OF A KIND

$1000 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE Just Bead It: A custom jewelry making party up to 3 hours away. I'll come to you with wine, small bites and all of the fixings to make a beautiful semi-precious stretch bracelet. You pick your stone, tassel, charm and signature lock and be a maker for the evening.

Thank you for considering to fund me,

Tony Perrin
Founder/Owner/Maker and Shaker

www.lockandkeydesign.com

I have seen tremendous growth over those three years by developing a unique, artisan design aesthetic and then targeting my core consumer through multiple distribution channels. I am now at the intersection where I am ready to grow bigger, capture the momentum that I have built and create a fully sustainable business for my family and my team. That I can not do with out your help.

I attend local festivals, up to twelve a year, where I sell directly to consumers. I have begun the shift to more juried art shows which are harder to get into and generally attract more serious buyers then the local art festival. I have already had successful shows in Nashville and Knoxville TN.

Your funding will allow me to apply for additional juried art shows for the 2018 fiscal year. There are amazing art shows around the country and your support will allow me to take the risk in new cities and in front of new audiences. For the second half of 2017 I am already traveling to both Washington D.C. and Louisville KY and your funding will off set travel costs, inventory needs, insurance and space fees to name a few.
I launched my website http://www.lockandkeydesign.com in early 2016. I have seen some success but I am missing the opportunity to capture the on-line consumer.
Your funding will allow me to produce inventory just for the website. I will also invest in on line marketing as well as SEO optimization.

I have approached key boutiques in the Nashville area and have nurtured amazing relationships with 8 boutiques so far. I work with them individually to create local partnerships. As a local Nashville art jeweler these boutiques are key to my business.

I attended my first wholesale trade show in Atlanta this past June with great response and after successful follow up great sales. I am excited to be expanding this Fall to Atlanta, Hilton Head and Charlotte-NC to name a few.

I need to continue the momentum and return to Atlanta in October for the SP 18 market and 2018 markets. These shows are extremely expensive and to not only solidify new accounts but grow new retailers will need marketing dollars as well to reach out for pre-sales.

Many viewing my collection in Atlanta suggested I also attend the Dallas market. With a great high end clientele it can be a key market for Lock and Key. Your funding will help me attend my first wholesale market in Dallas in 2018.

I am always trying to think outside the box. From private trunk shows, new partnerships and pop up events I am always trying to reach my consumers in new ways. I am excited to announce I will be featured in the August issue of Nashville Arts Magazine.
All of the above have expenses and I want to continue to do new events as consumers attention needs to be captured by excited, outside the box experiences.
As the Owner, Designer, Marketing and Sales Director and all around Maker and Shaker it is time to reach out to you and ask to help me take the next step. 2017 has been a big year so far.

And don't forget about 2018...  new national markets, new juried art shows which will mean expanding my team to include additional production help because with each new market there will be new orders, more raw materials and faster hands.
I need $15,000 in order to take the next steps needed to grow my small business.
I have really fun and amazing EXCLUSIVE perks to thank you for supporting my journey.

I am grateful to each and every one of you. I want you to know that my goals listed above are very intentional and have been thoughtfully decided upon from the learnings I have gained over the past three years of sweat equity I have invested into Lock and Key. This has taught me, amongst many other things, to mitigate as much risk as possible and always, ALWAYS be able to be flexible so if something is not working STOP and move forward with anew plan.

In addition I was accepted into a small business training course called Periscope through the Arts and Business Council of Nashville. Not only will I will leave a stronger small business owner but I will be partnered with a business mentor to continue my growth.

Because I don't know how many orders I will get from this campaign, I am putting an estimated ship date of October on all orders to give myself a little extra time to produce everything. While realistically I will be able to get the perks not hand made by myself out earlier, there is always a possibility of an overwhelming response and I want to ensure that I can get everyone taken care of by the date I have promised.
Lastly I have been training part time employees and interns my craft. I am ready to offer them more hours/pay to meet  the production growth and your funding will allow this to happen.
You can support my campaign by getting the word out, letting people know about a small artisan business and help #supportsmall.
Thank you for supporting a small business and making it possible for this artist to work closer to becoming a sustainable business for his family.
$10 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- Just Cuz: Grateful for your support
$25 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- Flair Plz: 1"" pin set
$40 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- It's All in the Journal- For all of your little secrets:
$50 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- Slitherin' Tee: Super soft heather gray t-shirt designed just for the campaign.
$85 Coast Away- natural agate slices: Comes in a pair

$85 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE- All Zipped Up and Ready to Go: A zipper bag for everything you need for an adventure. Gold metallic graphic printed on a black canvas bag, Chunky gold zipper and champagne satin lining details. Dimensions 9""x6.5""

$125 A Ring for the Ages: Custom made antique bronze sculpted ring. 1/2"" by 3/4"" this new classic ring can be worn with anything. Textured with a mold I made from a red oak tree in my backyard the signet style ring seamlessly blends to contrasting materials wood and metal. Something Tolkien would be proud of.
$125 Studded: A perfect pair of studs for any occasion. Just enough sparkle. Each pair are unique in color due to the natural stone variances. 3/4"" in diameter
$225 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE: A Ring For Cocktailing In. LIMITED EDITION and ONE OF A KIND
Examples of the ring with each cabochon being about 1"" a bold statement indeed. Wrapped in bronze and hand sculpted to your specific size.

$350 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE: A Sea of Aquamarine. One of a kind designed necklace using faceted aquamarine beads and a secretly designed pendant. Option to include a piece off your own in the necklace deign. LIMITED EDITION and ONE OF A KIND

$1000 CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE Just Bead It: A custom jewelry making party up to 3 hours away. I'll come to you with wine, small bites and all of the fixings to make a beautiful semi-precious stretch bracelet. You pick your stone, tassel, charm and signature lock and be a maker for the evening.
Thank you for considering to fund me,Tony PerrinFounder/Owner/Maker and Shaker

Born in Liberia, West Africa and raised in different countries around the globe, I have always been a cultural nomad and anomaly wherever I went. Thanks to the unexpected support from my father, I gave up my acceptance into a  prominent agricultural program to study fashion design instead.

I knew by doing what I loved, I would one day, achieve something great, not for myself, but for those who pushed me to pursue my dreams and, for those who never had the opportunities my parents provided me.

It all started with a piece of fabric, some thread and an old sewing machine. I wanted something that could defy the status quo. It was an arduous process that took numerous years and multiple filings with the US Patent Office, but it finally paid off and the patent approval was granted in mid 2016.
I am asking you, to pledge your hard earned money for a purse
column2: simple as that! Except, this is not any other fashion accessory.

column1: This is a patented, never before seen bag ,that solves many problems for the modern day individual, looking to establish and link their identity to what they wear. It is not only about perception but most importantly, about utility and the ability to compliment the wearers lifestyle without much effort. Flexibility and versatility  across different lifestyles are its key features.
By funding this campaign, you will be a pioneer in making this Invention come into realization on a global scale. You will push this invention further and be a part of a much larger movement.

The ultimate goal is to create a brand using this patented bag as a catalyst for the establishment of a fashion powerhouse.  I intend to create a business focused around cultivating unique ideas and talents like mine in a manner that is socially responsible and a means to help those who would be otherwise be overlooked, and exploited.
The first and most difficult hurdle has been conquered- I HAVE A PATENT  !!!!

The fabrics and trims required for production will be ordered after the campaign closes. Possible challenges may include limited supply of initially proposed material, and delay in receiving the supplies which could push the delivery time further out.

The first collection will be manufactured by a Small, local manufacturing company. Due to the the fact that this is the first time the product will be manufactured on a large scale and given that it is a brand new invention, there may be challenges as it  relates to production planning and implementing lean production techniques.
Knowing the potential challenges that may arise, I have considered alternative sourcing and manufacturing strategies that will help prevent any major setback.

This is a great platform to not only raise funds but also help spread the word and make wonderful connections! I welcome and thank you for all your efforts towards any help you can provide, monetarily or otherwise.
