Made, placed and delivered with utmost care. The wooden material and shiny finish, make the chief case robust yet stylish.Keeps all your Bruno Watches and favorite straps in place…Leather-made, perfect for storing single watches.So you can store those majestic leather straps separately, untouched and discrete.For watch lovers and their infinite collection, keep them all safe and well-arranged.Be the First to Own a Bruno Watch  We have worked day in, day out to bring a masterpiece to life, and we will keep striving hard until you are have received your Bruno Watch and are fully contented!  Be the first to lay hands on this exquisite timepiece, exemplary of its magnificence and high performance. And, make Bruno a success with your generous contributions!  We promise that you’ll take immense pride in our creation, every time you wear it!  For any assistance , contact us at :- support@davidbrunowatches.comRisks and challengesOur production strategy is unfailing and delivery plan is rock-solid. We are aware that despite the thought and effort, our project may face unforeseen issues, but we have anticipated and planned for potential risks. Our project is backed with a 30-day return policy, which makes it a risk-free investment.We invested over 2 years in designing, developing, and finalizing the product. Our production is quite planned and advanced and we are very confident about our capacity to deliver high-quality products on time. Moreover, we do not anticipate delays to our timeline owing to our professional and skillful suppliers. Also, we promise to keep you informed at all times, during the campaign and afterwards.We would also like to thank you for all the support and we are excited to begin our new journey with you, the Indiegogo community!",65.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1:
The Half Century Coat Is:

1. A Nearly Indestructible Wool Coat, made in California from Natures Most High-Tech Materials. We’ve spend years testing and designing the perfect year-round coat thats ready for anything you throw at it!
column2:
>

 

2. Strong. Very Strong. Our reinforced wool is over 6x stronger than cotton. Our thread is is expedition-gear worthy and paired with the strongest stitching in the game. Our all natural buttons are made from the Tagua Palm and are even harder than several metals on the mineral scale. It's as close to indestructible as apparel comes.
column5:
>

 

3. Designed to Save You Money. In a world where clothing is meant to be disposable, this coat promises to outlast anything else in your closet, saving you money by reducing your outerwear budget.
column6:
>

 

4. Natural and Sustainable. Made almost entirely from natural materials, this coat eases the strain put on our environment by other clothing brands.
column7:
>

 

5. Comfortable 365 days a year. It is fully breathable, moisture wicking, odor-repellent and anti-microbial. Meaning it always stays fresh without ever washing it. Yes, washing is optional, but never necessary.
column8:
>

 

6. Proven To Last At Least 50 Years. Inspired by the incredibly robust build quality of mid 20th century outdoorsman and work coats, but further strengthened with reinforced materials. Our detailed quality control ensures each coat is worthy of its journey before it is shipped out.
column9:
>

 

7. Shipped Direct. We cut out the middleman and are able to bring you the Half Century Coat at 50% off retail. After our campaign, it will retail for $250. Similar wool coats can sell for up to $500, but most of that goes toward some brand name, and even those can’t compare to the Half Century Coat.
column10:
>

True Unisex Fit

The Half Century Coat was was created from a fully custom template unique especially to us. It was designed from the very beginning to fit equally well on men and women. A double pleat is combined with a form fitting taper which compliments the chest and hips, which helps give a slimming and tailored look on all sizes.
column11:
>

 

Fit Guide

We are offering 6 sizing options that accommodate everyone from waist size 20-40+. Below is a fit guide in both inches and centimeters. For female customers  looking for the classic “boyfriend” fit, we recommend going up 1-2 sizes. Please message us if you have any questions about your sizing.

column2:
>

 

Custom Coats

Our factory can make a handful of optional customized coats during our campaign. If you select to pre-order the “Custom Coat” option, you will have the ability to choose from a dozen different color options in both the the checkered pattern as well as some solid colors. You will work with a team member to make your selections after the campaign is concluded. Pricing is $495 and limited to 10 exclusive customers.

Scarf

Add an awesome 10” x 55” scarf to your order for only $19. You can mix and match from 3 color choices.

>

            

","Forever Flannel available in 5 Beautiful Colors

column1: <div data-alt-text=""Comments on the SilverSocks"" data-caption=""Comments on the SilverSocks"" data-id=""26104077""><figure style=""margin: 0px
We created BeClothed because we wanted to develop products that are comfortable, look great and are better for the environment.

We believe it is our mission to reinvent the relationship you have with your everyday wear. We do this by making clothing that is not only good for you but for the world too. Our clothes are designed to eliminate odour, thereby requiring you to wash them less often, leading to less wasted water, energy and wear on your clothes.

Between our three Kickstarter campaigns for the SilverSocks No-Show (10,000+ pairs), SilverSocks Crew (15,000+ pairs), the Silver Underwear (6,000+ pairs) and our website, BeClothed.com (75,000+ pairs), we've revolutionised the way over 100,000+ people use their undergarments. 

 

Check out our site here: www.beclothed.com
<div data-alt-text=""Some people who've written about us"" data-caption=""Some people who've written about us"" data-id=""26104806""><figure style=""margin: 0px

column2: >Some nice folks who've written about us

column1: Born out the frustration that our clothes would never be the way we wanted, we set out to disrupt an outdated industry which is focused on planned obsolescence, the practice of intentionally and artificially limiting the useful life of a product for the purpose of driving more sales, something we're completely against.

We’re dedicated to crafting high-quality timeless products designed to last (and, hence, reduce waste). Our products are made from some of the best materials and are intentionally designed to last for years.
Q: Do the Silver Ankle Socks only come in Cotton and these colours?

A: If the campaign does well, we’ll add more colours and/or materials if there is demand.

 

Q: How much does shipping cost to my country?

A: We offer Free Tracked Shipping across the world, wherever you are.

 

 Q: How do I choose my colour, size and provide my shipping address?

A: The BackerKit surveys will be sent out 14-16 days after the campaign ends. You'll receive them to your Indiegogo email - everything you need to give us will be provided in there.

 

Q: How do I track my package?

A: You will be emailed a link three days before it goes into the carrier's system which will let you track your package every step of the way.

 

Q: Is there any warranty?

A: All our products come with a one year warranty, free of charge. This is in addition to your statutory consumer rights.

 

I have another question you haven't answered here
There are a bunch of ways to contact us to enquire or even make your thoughts known - you don't even need to back the project for some:
• Indiegogo Comments: On the project page tab - you need to back it to comment
•  Direct Email: shoot us an email at: support (at) beclothed (dot) com

Short Summary

Imagine Eliza Doolittle showed up at Ascot (I'm referencing My Fair Lady
-- the Audrey Hepburn movie) without her breathtaking hat. Or, Dolly
Levy (from the movie Hello Dolly, starring Barbara Streisand) appeared
at the Harmonious Gardens Restaurant without her large feathered head
piece. Hats make history! For my guy supporters out there -- how do you
remember Clark Gable in Gone With the Wind or Humphrey Bogart in
Casablanca? I would bet they would be less memorable without their hats.
Breaking into a business that is deemed ""old hat"" (pardon the pun) is
difficult just as any niche business adventure would be. However, doing
it without the support of good friends, family and strangers (who
hopefully will become friends one day) is darned near impossible. What
began as a hobby is slowly turning into a business as I get more and
more custom orders -- mainly for American Civil War reenactment head
wear and party fascinators (see photos below or visit my website).  However, if I am going to spread
the word about the elegance, affordability and availability of hats, I

need a venue to do it -- DC Fashion Week fashion show is that venue. 

Fashion is expensive

To be in the fashion show I will need:

  • $500 for the entrance fee
• $300 for the models clothing (I provide the hats, yes, but I also have to provide clothes for them)
• $250 in marketing materials to hand out to potential clients, media and participants
• $550 in wholesale supplies to make the hats to show (12-15 needed)
• That's $1,600 to be in the show to prove that hats are wanted and hat making is not a dead art! I have some of the funding but I need some from great people like you who want to see me succeed!

The Impact

Why your contribution will make a difference in wearable art:

  • Millinery is a dying art and I want to bring it to life again
until now, I have used only word-of-mouth marketing and placed ads in
one small publication in my local area but I need to do more, this fashion show is that extra umph I need to bring back the art of millinery

• The possibilities are endless -- If I can break into this business and make a profit, I plan on teaching a young lady or gentleman (an apprentice per se) the art to keep it alive and give a girl (or guy) a job.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know you might not be able to give right now with the economy as tight as it is but if you love fashion and/or art, please share my campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, blog or anywhere else to get it exposure. You can even use the Indiegogo tools to help share. Thank you for whatever way you can support me and this great adventure of art!

column5: >We wanted to remind our loved ones that they are perfect the way they are.
column9: >We wanted that message to be kept with them at all times and have them be reminded that they are beautiful, lovely..simply perfect.

column5: >The intention was to create something that was affordable by many and had a positive impact on most. Simply engraving a bracelet with beautiful words, sounded rather backwards in this age of wearables but it seemed perfect for this mission. Hence a beautiful bracelet, with a touching message that means, ""You are beautiful just the way you are"" was born.

column1: We are two designers based in Seoul, South Korea.

Hyun Kyung, a jewelry designer specializing in metalsmithing and Zuno, a communications designer specializing in copywriting. With this combination it was natural to build a product that told a moving story.

column2: >We wanted to tell people that they are beautiful

column1: Living in a society where appearing beautiful seems to govern many aspects of life, many around us seem to live day to day lives constantly under pressure to look and act more beautiful, forgetting that they actually are.

A simple search online of the word ""beauty"" results in a variety of articles and blog posts on how to become a super star. From simple make up tips to losing weight to even getting extensive plastic surgery, it seems that everyone is preoccupied with the notion of a ""perfect"" appearance without realizing that they already are.

It is true that one of the hardest things is to have the courage and the strength to lovingly but honestly accept yourself. But it is also true that not a lot of resources exist to encourage that people are fine the way they are.

Of all resources, many times, the best ones are just small gestures. A simple pat on the back, a warm smile or just a small hug can tell that person that they are perfect, beautiful, amazing just the way they are.
As a way to portray that message, we wanted to tell people a simple message that they are beautiful..and something more than that.

column8: >because of the word ""arum"" which is the main word for the phrase ""넌 있는 그대로가 아름다워."" It roughly translates to beautiful but has a meaning that is slightly different than that.
column15: >""arum"" is a Korean word that not only sounds beautiful, but also has the meaning of both inner and outer beauty, all the while including the traits of being lovely, warm hearted, and kind. Most importantly, it focuses on the balance and harmony of being...well, arum.

column1: We wanted to tell people that not only are they beautiful, but also they are lovely, warm hearted, kind and most importantly harmoniously so.
An Engraved bracelet that can be worn at all times
The bracelet itself is easy, modern, and simple to be worn any time of the day telling you that you are beautiful.
With the engraving on the back of the bracelet, it provides a subtle yet nuanced reminder that ""You are beautiful just the way you are.""
It tells you that you always have been beautiful.
It is not something that will make you more beautiful. Rather, it will let you discover that you already have been.

We created this bracelet that represents a way of expressing that all individuals are “arum” in their own way. The bracelet reads “넌 있는 그대로가 아름다워” which resonates an underlying message that “You yourself are arum.""

We believe that a subtle reminder is all that you need to bring out that confident smile. And that confident smile is worth much more than anything in the world. A small nuanced gesture - that surprisingly inspires you as you go about your day. Just by glancing at the back of the plate, we want to brighten someone’s day, put a smile on someone's face and most importantly remind them that they are “be.arum.""
To match the genuineness of each bracelet, be.arum is sincerely designed to deliver a beautiful smile to those that wear it.
We source our premium materials directly from local suppliers in Seoul, South Korea. Sterling silver, and leather are used to make this bracelet.
Watch Hyun Kyung, the lead designer for be.arum handcraft our precious bracelets.

We want to be able to make this message affordable to as many people as possible. After careful consideration of materials used, hours of labor, and skills we hope to provide the best options for all. The items include Free international shipping leaving from Seoul, South Korea.

At this time, Hyun Kyung is solely in charge of designing and handcrafting all the bracelets. Handcrafting each bracelet is an essential part of our bracelet as we hope to provide a heartwarming message that is not only engraved on the bracelet but lives with it.

column3: >Incorporating more like-minded designers to join in this movement.
>Creating more product lines with the powerful message
>Lowering prices by acquiring bulk deals in purchasing premium materials

column1:
Breakdown:

  • It takes time to make this bracelet. Since everything is handcrafted from the bracelet to the packaging, it is essential to have another set of hands to help us get the message across to as many people as possible. 
  • A bracelet is great, yet there could be more possibilities of weaving this message into other accessories. A necklace would be the next step to match the beautiful bracelet.
  • We want to make this bracelet affordable to most. To do this, we need to cut costs and that is possible through bulk purchasing. At this time we purchase our materials individually per order, if we are able to purchase materials in bulk, the price of the bracelet will become more affordable.

We want to make an impact

Beauty is in the eyes of the beholder. Everyone is beautiful in their own way and there is no right or wrong to being beautiful. We believe that true beauty is earned and being confident about being beautiful is the first step. We want to live in a society where individuality is respected and beauty is cherished. We definitely do not want to be in a society where beauty is judged by mere factors such as height, weight, size, and etc.
You can help make a difference. It may be a small one, but we sure believe it will be an impactful one.

Share this beautiful - arum campaign

Contribute to making the world a bit more beautiful. Share this campaign and let people around you know that they are beautiful.
Better yet, tell them, ""넌 있는 그대로가 아름다워."" ""You are beautiful just as you are.""

We wanted to remind our loved ones that they are perfect the way they are. We wanted that message to be kept with them at all times and have them be reminded that they are beautiful, lovely..simply perfect.

The intention was to create something that was affordable by many and had a positive impact on most. Simply engraving a bracelet with beautiful words, sounded rather backwards in this age of wearables but it seemed perfect for this mission. Hence a beautiful bracelet, with a touching message that means, ""You are beautiful just the way you are"" was born.
We are two designers based in Seoul, South Korea.

Hyun Kyung, a jewelry designer specializing in metalsmithing and Zuno, a communications designer specializing in copywriting. With this combination it was natural to build a product that told a moving story.
We wanted to tell people that they are beautiful

Living in a society where appearing beautiful seems to govern many aspects of life, many around us seem to live day to day lives constantly under pressure to look and act more beautiful, forgetting that they actually are.

A simple search online of the word ""beauty"" results in a variety of articles and blog posts on how to become a super star. From simple make up tips to losing weight to even getting extensive plastic surgery, it seems that everyone is preoccupied with the notion of a ""perfect"" appearance without realizing that they already are.

It is true that one of the hardest things is to have the courage and the strength to lovingly but honestly accept yourself. But it is also true that not a lot of resources exist to encourage that people are fine the way they are.

Of all resources, many times, the best ones are just small gestures. A simple pat on the back, a warm smile or just a small hug can tell that person that they are perfect, beautiful, amazing just the way they are.
As a way to portray that message, we wanted to tell people a simple message that they are beautiful..and something more than that.

because of the word ""arum"" which is the main word for the phrase ""넌 있는 그대로가 아름다워."" It roughly translates to beautiful but has a meaning that is slightly different than that. ""arum"" is a Korean word that not only sounds beautiful, but also has the meaning of both inner and outer beauty, all the while including the traits of being lovely, warm hearted, and kind. Most importantly, it focuses on the balance and harmony of being...well, arum.
We wanted to tell people that not only are they beautiful, but also they are lovely, warm hearted, kind and most importantly harmoniously so.
An Engraved bracelet that can be worn at all times
The bracelet itself is easy, modern, and simple to be worn any time of the day telling you that you are beautiful.
With the engraving on the back of the bracelet, it provides a subtle yet nuanced reminder that ""You are beautiful just the way you are.""
It tells you that you always have been beautiful.
It is not something that will make you more beautiful. Rather, it will let you discover that you already have been.

We created this bracelet that represents a way of expressing that all individuals are “arum” in their own way. The bracelet reads “넌 있는 그대로가 아름다워” which resonates an underlying message that “You yourself are arum.""

We believe that a subtle reminder is all that you need to bring out that confident smile. And that confident smile is worth much more than anything in the world. A small nuanced gesture - that surprisingly inspires you as you go about your day. Just by glancing at the back of the plate, we want to brighten someone’s day, put a smile on someone's face and most importantly remind them that they are “be.arum.""
To match the genuineness of each bracelet, be.arum is sincerely designed to deliver a beautiful smile to those that wear it.
We source our premium materials directly from local suppliers in Seoul, South Korea. Sterling silver, and leather are used to make this bracelet.
Watch Hyun Kyung, the lead designer for be.arum handcraft our precious bracelets.

We want to be able to make this message affordable to as many people as possible. After careful consideration of materials used, hours of labor, and skills we hope to provide the best options for all. The items include Free international shipping leaving from Seoul, South Korea.
We want to tell this message to more people

At this time, Hyun Kyung is solely in charge of designing and handcrafting all the bracelets. Handcrafting each bracelet is an essential part of our bracelet as we hope to provide a heartwarming message that is not only engraved on the bracelet but lives with it.
Incorporating more like-minded designers to join in this movement.
Creating more product lines with the powerful message
Lowering prices by acquiring bulk deals in purchasing premium materials

Since everything is handcrafted from the bracelet to the packaging, it is essential to have another set of hands to help us get the message across to as many people as possible.  A bracelet is great, yet there could be more possibilities of weaving this message into other accessories. A necklace would be the next step to match the beautiful bracelet. We want to make this bracelet affordable to most. To do this, we need to cut costs and that is possible through bulk purchasing. At this time we purchase our materials individually per order, if we are able to purchase materials in bulk, the price of the bracelet will become more affordable.

We want to make an impact Beauty is in the eyes of the beholder. Everyone is beautiful in their own way and there is no right or wrong to being beautiful. We believe that true beauty is earned and being confident about being beautiful is the first step. We want to live in a society where individuality is respected and beauty is cherished. We definitely do not want to be in a society where beauty is judged by mere factors such as height, weight, size, and etc.
You can help make a difference. It may be a small one, but we sure believe it will be an impactful one.
Share this beautiful - arum campaign Contribute to making the world a bit more beautiful. Share this campaign and let people around you know that they are beautiful.
Better yet, tell them, ""넌 있는 그대로가 아름다워."" ""You are beautiful just as you are.""

column8: >Get to know a high-quality product that fits well.

column1: wearing Acossi Travel jeans and jackets, it doesn’t only keep up with the stylish
look but also offer flexible and comfort wearing, which Chef Don Peavy from the reality
show had his first pair of Acossi black travel flexible jeans and had a positive reaction.
column12: >How Acossi Travel Collection will Bring Change

column1: Natacha’s vision of business is matched by kindness and ability to give back. Traveling the world, has personally contributed to causes dear to her heart, including shipping boxes of clothes to Calcutta for an education charity founded by her childhood friend Hemley Gonzalez who founded Responsible Charity, supporting communities and villages across India. With the expansion and growth of the brand, the designer will continue to pay it forward and share in the profits with those who need it the most.
By Helping a Cause that Provide to
column5: >Children and Families Living in the Slums

column1: Acossi Jeans Travel collection is a uniquely stylish
look that is both approachable and inviting to the casual traveler and street wear
dweller. Our fitted jeans and jackets quickly become the closet staple of any
woman and man’s wardrobe, which the philosophy lifestyle is freedom. We’re
offering our unique design for woman and man that are fitted, comfort and
flexible on the body for people on the go and travelers, which makes these
collection designs different from your regular jeans and jackets.
You will be able to Pre-order our Travel jeans and jackets below cost only in this campaign. Perks Order is on the Right
By bringing this project campaign to Indiegogo and directly to you, we can cut out
distributors and retailers, and additional marketing expenses.
What we’re offering in this Campaign:
Denim jacket with leather stripe and

Acossi jeans was founded 4 years ago by fashion designer Natacha Lacosse when she began experimenting with denim, paint, rhinestones and other items as a way to escape the often dull and saturated market of jeans and jackets. Through her close research of trade shows, runways, early adapters and street-trends, she began to channel her fresh look to new and exciting designs. Starting with jeans and later adding jackets to her line, the internationally contemporary street wear and casual feel began to take hold. From the streets of Paris, to Milan and back to New York City where she currently resides, the mix of grit and elegance has given the brand a look like no other. Which all our denim was sourced by US suppliers personally and visited by the designer.

Our goal is to bring a trend worthy line of ready-to-wear jeans and jackets while landing them in stores at mid-range price, with an escalating pricing strategy for online retailers and other outlets.

Acossi Jeans has been featured in several fashion events, including Prêt A Porte in Milan, where it first received international recognition. The line has also been featured in the Hong Kong, Shanghai markets and New York City. Also has been sported by TV personality Don Peavy, of the prime time show: Chef Race: U.K. vs. U.S.
Acossi jeans chosen to support Responsible Charity organization which is a cause that support Children and families living in the slums and founded b
The denim jeans are made from US premium washed denim cotton with a specific blend of spandex giving it further comfort and flexibility.

The Leather skins are made from Lamb leather Nappa from India and Morocco. The tanning processes are aniline-dyed in a water bath. The dye used penetrates all layers of the leather and is transparent. This means that the leather’s natural visible pores are preserved and high-grade skins and hides can only achieve this process, which are environmentally friendly processes.
Zippers are made from YKK and other High quality zippers which been selected personally by designer
Clothing patterns are made in Italy from designer selected factory.
How fitting is done: Sizing mannequins are used to create the prototypes and patterns to perfect the fitting to the body and after goes through the production for manufacturing.
All creation ideas and prototype designs are envisioned, drawn and created by Natacha Lacosse before production.

We need your help to full fill our orders and have our first full production run for this year to release our travel jeans and jackets collection that was made in high quality and created for woman and man that’s on the go and travelers. You will also be able to own for this year if we reach our goal.
As an emerging brand, competing in the global market is a monumental battle. The base funding will help us showcase Acossi jeans to a larger audience of traders and retailers and able to distribute.
All the work has been done, we have our prototypes and ready to produce with our associated Manufactures in Asia.
Manufacturing – Already established relationship with a key manufacture is in place and ready to commence production and ship product
Distribution – Beginning in the US, we will gradually expand our channels to specific European and Asian markets.

Marketing – Viral social campaigns will create rapid-fire style dissemination of the brand. Out-of-the-box PR firms as well as conventional outlets will be on standby to address broader campaigns including print and billboards.
Growth- As the company brand grows, so will our outreach efforts to give back to marginalized communities across the world.
Q: How do I select multiple perks?

A: Simply add up all of the relevant contribution amounts, select the most expensive of your perks, and enter in your custom total contribution amount. We'll send you an email after you order to confirm your selection of items and colors.
Q: How do I calculate international shipping if I select multiple perks?
A: If you select multiple perks, please use the shipping amount that we have provided there. Please add up the individual international shipping amounts for all of the perks that you selected.
Q: When will my Item be Shipped and be ready?

A: Once we reach our goal and Indiegogo releases the funds, we can pay the initial deposit to begin production to the Manufacturer. Production time takes roughly 45 days depending on the quantity of the orders.
Q: What sizes does Acossi jeans offer?
A: We hope to offer more variety of sizes near future once we have gain enough to do so. The sizes on the chart we provided is the sizes will focus on producing.
Q: I already ordered but I would like to switch to different color or product. Can I do that?
A: Yes! Send us an email at info@acossijeans.com and we'll take care of you.         Visit us: www.acossijeans.com

Natacha’s vision of business is matched by kindness and ability to give back. Traveling the world, has personally contributed to causes dear to her heart, including shipping boxes of clothes to Calcutta for an education charity founded by her childhood friend Hemley Gonzalez who founded Responsible Charity, supporting communities and villages across India. With the expansion and growth of the brand, the designer will continue to pay it forward and share in the profits with those who need it the most.

Acossi jeans was founded 4 years ago by fashion designer Natacha Lacosse when she began experimenting with denim, paint, rhinestones and other items as a way to escape the often dull and saturated market of jeans and jackets. Through her close research of trade shows, runways, early adapters and street-trends, she began to channel her fresh look to new and exciting designs. Starting with jeans and later adding jackets to her line, the internationally contemporary street wear and casual feel began to take hold. From the streets of Paris, to Milan and back to New York City where she currently resides, the mix of grit and elegance has given the brand a look like no other. Which all our denim was sourced by US suppliers personally and visited by the designer.

Our goal is to bring a trend worthy line of ready-to-wear jeans and jackets while landing them in stores at mid-range price, with an escalating pricing strategy for online retailers and other outlets.

Acossi Jeans has been featured in several fashion events, including Prêt A Porte in Milan, where it first received international recognition. The line has also been featured in the Hong Kong, Shanghai markets and New York City. Also has been sported by TV personality Don Peavy, of the prime time show: Chef Race: U.K. vs. U.S.
Acossi jeans chosen to support Responsible Charity organization which is a cause that support Children and families living in the slums and founded by Hemley Gonzales.
How Acossi Travel jeans & jackets made:
The denim jeans are made from US premium washed denim cotton with a specific blend of spandex giving it further comfort and flexibility.

The Leather skins are made from Lamb leather Nappa from India and Morocco. The tanning processes are aniline-dyed in a water bath. The dye used penetrates all layers of the leather and is transparent. This means that the leather’s natural visible pores are preserved and high-grade skins and hides can only achieve this process, which are environmentally friendly processes.
Zippers are made from YKK and other High quality zippers which been selected personally by designer
Clothing patterns are made in Italy from designer selected factory.
How fitting is done: Sizing mannequins are used to create the prototypes and patterns to perfect the fitting to the body and after goes through the production for manufacturing.
All creation ideas and prototype designs are envisioned, drawn and created by Natacha Lacosse before production.

By SHARING OUR STORY TO OTHERS
I am Colette Welch, creator and owner of ""SHUNAMI"". Opening my own
store has been my life's dream. Hard work, dedication, and a true passion for
shoes has brought me here. Your contribution will go towards the store
build-out, the fixtures and of course amazing, unique, awesome quality shoes.
My story can best be told through the eyes of my loyal customers and friends. I
would like to share three testimonials with you. My goal is for everyone buying
shoes to walk away with their own ""SHUNAMI"" experience.
I have purchased shoes elsewhere but, frankly, the shoes I wear most often and
am happiest with are from Colette. Her business acumen, product knowledge and
service keep me a customer. We need a quality shoe store that is not a DSW and
I can only hope and look forward to Colette's continuing on in the spirit""
have been buying shoes from Colette for 20 years because the first time I met
her in Calhoun Square, I knew I was with someone that cared about what I needed
and could intuit what I wanted. She has the ability to get me to try things I
haven't considered because she knows what lifestyle I have and what I will be
happy with in the long run. She also has a deep knowledge of designers and
shoemakers and remembers what I have in my closet. She is bar-none the best,
and my husband, who only shops now and then, remembers every pair of shoes he
has bought from Colette and agrees with me she is the one.""- J. Evans,
daughters and I like shoes, but even better, we enjoy buying them from Colette.
For the past 20 years, every time that I can remember buying shoes, they were
from Colette. Why? Because the sales person is the soul of the store. Colette
fondly remembers our best purchases. Often we bought the same shoes she was
wearing. There just isn't a price you can put on a personal relationship with
somebody who knows shoes, and knows your taste in shoes. Colette sold us shoes
that spurted flames and heels that said '40's flirt. She sold us amazing boots,
classics that took our daughter to college and me on a book tour. She sold us
shoes that gave us confidence, and UGGS I could schlep these daughters to
school in half-asleep. In short, she helped us get from there to here""
is committed to giving back to the community.  Shoes that you can spare,
someone else can wear.  We plan to have an annual event to provide a way
to give back to our community.
So if you were a fan of BayStreet Shoes and would like to see the
tradition reinvented, please support my ""SHUNAMI"" Indigogo
campaign by donating in whatever amount you can. Help support a knowledgeable
and enthusiastic Minnesota businesswoman who embodies a sense of community and caring.

column1: Project Light 'Er Up is created to offer extraordinary lighters. The main goal is to bring out Latvian culture & share it worldwide. It's quite a specific design, being as interesting for people around the world, as it is for Latvians. The idea was born in September 2014, and there have been plenty of changes since then. Now, it's official – it has to be a movement.
Creative Process Now how did I get here?

First, I love the idea of charms that are always by my side, though never found the one I truly cared for. Since I'm passioned about design, too, a thought came into my mind – why not advance the routine & make a revolution?
So the crazy sketching period was on.

Starting from September 2014, there have been several ideas of pursuing the lighters just the right way, that have developed into various beautiful designs, engraved & printed as well. I believe in pure simplicity at all cause, and I represent it within my work.
God's sign symbolizes the male power, sky, light and striving upwards. Opening downwards symbolizes movement, volatility and cyclicality. God is benevolent guardian and companion

Mara's cross is considered the symbol of fire, it is a sign of happiness and love, which protects them from evil. As Mara was seen as a guardian of the farm, with Mara cross was guarded material well-being - houses and bread - she protected the family's future.
Every lighter contains a part of the culture, in this case it's Latvian historical symbols. Later on, I am planning on building a cultural empire, containing as many nationalities as possible.
Funding & Perks The main point of this funding is the actual printing costs, to even make a lighter look as it should. Also, it's about the packaging – a black leather case for every lighter.

Then, I have to keep the online store going, when it comes to hosting & taking care of the daily marketing tasks: ads & seasonal campaigns. Check out the current version and be so kind to let me know what you think: Light 'Er Up
Next, I have to be prepared for worldwide shipping, since I am positioning this as an international project. I have never done anything this huge before.
If a great amount of lighters are needed, there's a special perk for 50 pcs standard or GOLD editions available, saving up to $500.

If you're interested to help and more enthusiastic about some great wear than lighters, I am glad to announce the first ever Light 'Er Up t–shirt collection. Be the first to receive this 100% cotton shirt & support a revolution!
If the shirts turn out to have a good run, EXCLUSIVE Mara's cross & God's sign designs will be added.

Also, Light 'Er Up have several connections & partnerships pending, including some of the highest ranked gift shops in Riga, and as they have agreed to place the lighters at their stores, I need to produce them as  soon as possible.
My name is Katrina, I'm a 21–year–old, living in Riga, Latvia. I am a Psychology & Criminology student, also passioned about the culture and graphic design.

With creating Light 'Er Up, my aim is to make history interesting, as well as popularize the national traditions. Since I'm trying to make a change, I believe the timing is great, because a project like this has not been made yet.
Why Light 'Er Up? Light 'Er Up is made to have two great meanings.
First, it has a context of lighting a fire, as it should be. Then, as a reaction, the mood lightens up. Also, it represents the flame, which has to be lit.

Honestly, the only challenges that could make me worried are some unexpected difficulties packing the lighters up or shipping them out. Hope to get some help from my dearest friends, if the amount of work gets totally out of hand.
As I am thinking this through, here's the approximate schedule:

In June, the campaign is running at it's best to gain it's main goal, meanwhile covering the status in the media, as well as promoting the online store & making new connections to even more gift shops around the country.

After finishing the campaign, according to the collected amount of donations & contributions, the manufacturing starts. It takes up to 7 working days to actually produce all of the rewards mentioned above. I intend on shipping the ordered rewards regardless of the total outcome.

Once the lighters are ready, engraved, printed & packed, the shipping is on! The approximate date of sending them out is July 1. The standard shipping cost is already calculated & included when contributing.

The lighters will take up the gift shops just in time for the summer heat & various festivals. I have reserved spots in different events to promote Light 'Er Up when the campaign is successful and I reach the manufacturing goal.
Thank you for having the time to regard this project!
For additional questions & partnership inquiries don't hesitate to reach out: katrina@lighterup.lv",13.0,0,"1 Campaign

We welcome YOU to be a part of our team!

The Classy Girl Founding Family (CGFF) is a special group consisting of those that pledged at least $5 bucks to our Indiegogo campaign.  We will not host this offer ever again. Although we already have a current client list, the Founding Family will have their own EXCLUSIVE email list. We plan to use CGFF as a soundboard on all projects and future product releases. 

What does that mean?  Impressive discounts on future gear and a direct line of communication with you so we can continue to evolve as a brand, together, for future generations.

column5: >Sexual Nature of the Topic: It's 2015 and there are still a lot of people out there that are freaked out with the thought of nipples, let alone feel comfortable talking about them. Instead of hiding from the problem we're facing it head on by creating only tasteful marketing campaigns and adding just the right amount of humor, when appropriate. When done tastefully, we will bring the right kind of attention to the problem and highlight our classiest of solutions.

Short Summary

Narelle (formerly Young) and Craig Moodie are getting ready for their next Summer range of cool kids clothing. With an awesome Winter collection now available in select stores and through the Young and Moodie online store, the team is excited to get things moving on the Summer line production. Only problem is the dreaded cash flow monster is rearing it's head again and we need your help to get past it.
The vicious cycle of ""You need money to make....stuff""
We again have approximately 70% of the production and shipping costs needed but our garments will not be released until that final payment is made, come the time.

What we are offering once again to all our lovely supporters (and hopefully some new ones!) is the exclusive opportunity to Pre-Purchase a selection of the Summer range at a discounted price. The Collection will be available in sizes 2-8.The more someone contributes, the cheaper the garments get.
There are a range of Perks to choose from on the right hand side of the page.

>If you've read this far you may as well take a peek below to see how easy it is to help a small business keep growing.

What We Need &

column1:
• We have a goal of AU$4500 which is necessary to pay our final production and shipping costs. We have also accounted for the campaign fee and Paypal fees for receiving the campaign funds.
  • We also to need to reach our funding goal in order to avoid a higher percentage fee on the campaign. 
  • As a contributor, you will have the opportunity to choose a Perk option and have some cool new threads coming your way for Summer 15.

The Impact

Pre-Purchasing our clothing means we can avoid costly bank loans while offering our early contributors great discounts. Win win!

• Help a small business to keep evolving and feel great knowing that you've been a vital part in it.
  • We are proud to have had a successful crowd funding campaign for our Winter range and look forward to completing another.
  • Get behind us today and see what can be achieved by a community of followers.

column2:
Challenges

As we explained in our first crowd funding campaign, we have tried to be as meticulous as possible to avoid any potential mistakes. There are obstacles that are out of our control though like customs delays and currency fluctuations. Our winter range we had delivered with enough time to allow for any hold ups and we are trying to allow for a little further drop in the AU dollar against the US.

column1:
If we raise over our goal it simply means we have a further buffer for the possible currency difference come time of final payment. Or we could also invest in a little more stock for the designs we anticipate being more popular. Either way, every contribution will be helping us to grow our brand of truly unique kids clothing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
• If you personally don't have the need for our kids wear but still want to help here are a few things you could try.

• Share, share and share some more! The more people that know about this campaign the more likely we will be connecting with like minded folks that will fall in love with our style. There are social sharing icons on this page and check out the next tip to go a step better.
  • Email your close friends that have children with the link below, asking them for their help in supporting our plight.

","Short Summary Narelle (formerly Young) and Craig Moodie are getting ready for their next Summer range of cool kids clothing. With an awesome Winter collection now available in select stores and through the Young and Moodie online store, the team is excited to get things moving on the Summer line production. Only problem is the dreaded cash flow monster is rearing it's head again and we need your help to get past it.
The vicious cycle of ""You need money to make....stuff""
We again have approximately 70% of the production and shipping costs needed but our garments will not be released until that final payment is made, come the time.

What we are offering once again to all our lovely supporters (and hopefully some new ones!) is the exclusive opportunity to Pre-Purchase a selection of the Summer range at a discounted price. The Collection will be available in sizes 2-8.The more someone contributes, the cheaper the garments get.

There are a range of Perks to choose from on the right hand side of the page. If you've read this far you may as well take a peek below to see how easy it is to help a small business keep growing.   What We Need & What You Get Break down:

We have a goal of AU$4500 which is necessary to pay our final production and shipping costs. We have also accounted for the campaign fee and Paypal fees for receiving the campaign funds. We also to need to reach our funding goal in order to avoid a higher percentage fee on the campaign.  As a contributor, you will have the opportunity to choose a Perk option and have some cool new threads coming your way for Summer 15.
The Impact Pre-Purchasing our clothing means we can avoid costly bank loans while offering our early contributors great discounts. Win win!

Help a small business to keep evolving and feel great knowing that you've been a vital part in it. We are proud to have had a successful crowd funding campaign for our Winter range and look forward to completing another. Get behind us today and see what can be achieved by a community of followers.

Risks & Challenges  As we explained in our first crowd funding campaign, we have tried to be as meticulous as possible to avoid any potential mistakes. There are obstacles that are out of our control though like customs delays and currency fluctuations. Our winter range we had delivered with enough time to allow for any hold ups and we are trying to allow for a little further drop in the AU dollar against the US.

If we raise over our goal it simply means we have a further buffer for the possible currency difference come time of final payment. Or we could also invest in a little more stock for the designs we anticipate being more popular. Either way, every contribution will be helping us to grow our brand of truly unique kids clothing.  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
If you personally don't have the need for our kids wear but still want to help here are a few things you could try.

Share, share and share some more! The more people that know about this campaign the more likely we will be connecting with like minded folks that will fall in love with our style. There are social sharing icons on this page and check out the next tip to go a step better. Email your close friends that have children with the link below, asking them for their help in supporting our plight.

We have a great idea in store that will protect motorcycle riders and help them enjoy their ride.

""Hello, I’m here to describe our idea… or watch the video, is better
column2:
-)""
Often the byker rides his motorcycle and sometimes finds himself in very dangerous situations due to careless car drivers.

Our ""Marvelous Idea"" wants to help the motorcycle driver in case of an accident and allow him to

column1: film with an HD camera (just like pro-cameras in use today) all of his
stunts so that he can watch them later with his friends.
column3:
/>

We know there are already some of “Intelligent” helmets with web,

column1:
audio, video, message and music connection and much more, but we, not want any “distraction” while driving.

There’s

nothing like VRH01-Helmet on the market.

We want use this helmet for two types of necessities:

SELF CARE and AUTO RECORDING

- Self-Care
The main idea is to concentrate, in one helmet, a completely independent
and automatic video surveillance system and a traceability GPS-system

in case you need it.

We will install on top of the helmet two wide-angle cameras. One to tape

what happens in front of you and the other for what happens behind you.
As soon as the rider starts his journey, the cameras (automatically) will begin filming everything that’s going on around him, with cycling recorder system (for many, many hours).

(We are working on guaranteeing a long battery supply)

In some scenarios, the bikers are sent flying into the
vegetation along the road where they remain injured and can even pass

column3:
/>

If the biker falls, the VRH-01 helmet, thanks to its sensors, will send a

column1: help request (images and GPS) and will interrupt all of its registrations
after a few minutes, allowing it to maintain the film that have been

already filmed.

- Auto Recording
When there’s a car accident, it’s difficult to understand the actual
dynamics of the events and to find out who’s wrong and who’s right, or how many times have you wished you could film your trips or your reckless swoops with your motorcycle?

column3:
/>

We’re a

column1: company that  develops hi-tech projects with a team of experienced
professionals that orchestrates a group of young designers. We aren’t new in
thinking great ideas. In 1997 we registered a patent for the first black-box in the World
with cameras to be used inside a car. Unfortunately there weren’t any
financiers at the time (in Italy) and we were forced to put away our idea.
idea will also have to be put away --

Help Us Share DryWeave to Your Friends!
If you can't contribute to our project financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some ways you can help:
• Get the word out and make some noise for DryWeave.
• Use the Indiegogo share tools to let your friends and family easily access our campaign!

We want to deliver this amazing product into your hands on time. In order for us to maintain the highest quality that you deserve, the risk of delay will always be there. We will try our best to stick with the timeline, but we will not deliver a product that you won't be proud with.

With that said, we are confident in our partners and their manufacturing capabilities with decades of textile production, providing quality goods to leading brands around the globe. We think that this collaboration have resulted fruitfully, and we think you're going to love DryWeave.
Our size has been matched with US size, so for anyone in Asia we would recommend to choose one size lower than your usual (if you buy M in Asia, you should get S).
2. Where do you ship and how much will shipping cost?

We ship globally! That means you can order DryWeave from wherever you are. Shipping to all countries other than Indonesia will have a flat rate of $12 (per perk). For those residing in Indonesia, shipping is free.
3. How come it takes so long to make?

We've custom ordered our fabric which means that the textile supplier will have to create them from scratch. Textile production will take roughly two months to make and then we proceed to shirt production which will take about one month before we ship them to you.
4. What if I want to change my order?
We will send a follow up survey for you to reconfirm your order or if you want to add more items.
5. What if I have more questions?
Feel free to contact us at info@valarathletics.com!

smart leash with complimentary phone application.

smart way!

CARLOS is a uniquely designed smart leash and phone application for your dog’s general health: safer and more comfortable walks and even making new friends while walking.
The health and happiness of their pets is a top priority for pet owners. Here is how this exclusive device can help to keep a healthy pet and ensure his/her safety.

column2: >CARLOS the smart leash emits light to aid you with waste pick-ups and general visibility at night.

column1: The beam of the leash is light-reflecting for better visibility during your night walks.
column2:
>Carlos omits its on light, so there is no need to use your phone’s flashlight feature. Easy waste pick-ups!

EMERGENCY BUTTON
>There is a unique alarm button feature on your CARLOS smartleash! In case of an emergency an alarm will sound and your GPS coordinates will be sent to the preliminarily selected people on your list.
>The leash indicates if there are other CARLOS smart leash users in your area. It will also let you know if their dog is friendly or unfriendly so you can avoid any uncomfortable encounters.
>DON’T GIVE FLEAS A BITING CHANCE
column3: >This innovative dog leash features a high-tech ultra-sound flea, tick and mosquito repellent, to keep these parasites away from you and your pet.

column1: After entering the basic information, you can easily connect your phone and the leash via Bluetooth.

column2: >You can also adjust the handle lights to fit your mood,

column1: while the cord is also light-reflecting.
The leash contains separate compartments for waste bags and treats. So practical!
With Carlos dead phone batteries are a thing of the past! Just connect your phone to Carlos through the USB, and you can talk, text and even listen to music without draining your phone’s battery.
of your walks is stored in the application. The program then compiles weekly
and monthly statistics about your pet’s walks.
your dog’s breed, age and weight, the application calculates the optimal lenght
of walks and alerts you in case you are under the suggested distance.

Any questions? You may contact your vet online through a live chat feature or schedule your pet’s next mandatory vaccination. The application will also store your pet’s illnesses and alert you about upcoming vet appointments.
Carlos users are a true community: all users share a common platform for chats, sharing photos and videos.
The application shows dog-friendly bars, restaurants, cafés nearby, as well as dog hostels, dog schools, parks, and pet hospitals.

With CARLOS you can order online anything your pet may need such as food, treats, clothes or toys. Through the application you can choose the desired brand and quantity to order and even set up an automatic re-order feature based on your preference.
The CARLOS smart leash was named after the innovators’ own four-legged family member, a Miniature Pinscher originating from Hungary and Israel.
It was the time and walks spent with Carlos that triggered the revolutionary smart leash idea. The designers’ goal is to have a healthier and happier pet and safer walks for the owners.
this campaign to better the lives of our pet family members! We want to see
them happy and healthy and have a long life to share with us.
Your contributions will help us manufacture this unique product
and end the era of ordinary and boring leashes. Our team of designers has worked over 6 months to come up with the best features and designs and we are excited
to finally turn the drawings into a real product.
want our manufacturing process to be conducted with quality detail, comfort,
strength and durability in mind for the dogs and their owners.

this campaign on your Facebook, and Twitter accounts so others can find out

Welcome!

    First I would like to start out by saying thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign page. This means a lot to me.

   My name is Kristofer Haney and I am very excited to share my business idea with you. We all have a desire for adventure and there is no better path to adventure than the open road. Since I was a young boy I have always had a fascination with the Volkswagen travel van. I used to think of how sweet it would be to cruise down the open highway towards my dream destinations, in one of these beautiful beasts. This vehicle is a combination of  classic style, comfort, and let's be honest downright awesomeness.

  In order to make my dream a reality, I will use the funds from this campaign to purchase and refurbish a few of these old school gems. Once the vans are mechanically sound and looking sexy, I plan to start a travel van rental service. People from all walks of life  may come share my dream and exercise their adventurer's spirit while sitting behind the wheel of one of these shaggin wagons.
column3:
>What your funds will help me achieve

 I have set a goal of $100,000 these funds will go towards
>Purchasing used/fair condition vw vans and restoring them to their original beauty.
>Hiring  experienced/certified Volkswagen mechanics and auto body repair technicians
>Purchase/rent secure area to house and maintain vans while they are not being rented

>  If I do not reach my campaign goal I will still use whatever funds you have helped me raise to invest towards the start up of my business/dream.

Once again, thanks for your time and support. Not everyone can make a donation but sharing my page would be much appreciated.


Kristofer Haney

column1: In-House Manufacturing- With our entry into the mass-production market, initially streamlining the production line is going to take some work and time
column2: however, being familiar with logistics processes and project management, we are confident we can accomplish our objectives. With a combined 30+ years of experience in the woodwork manufacturing business, long standing relationships with material, supplies, and packaging resources, vast knowledge &amp
column3: experience using most production equipment (i.e. CNC Machines, wide-belt sanders, finishing processes, production saws), we have understood and adapted to the production line process on various projects over the years.

column1: Complex Order Fulfilment - Its not hard to see the difficulty in reward fulfillment with as many rewards as we offer. In a dream world, everything works out perfectly and everyone gets their rewards exactly on time, every time. In our world, the real world, expected &
column2: unexpected problems arise from all directions. With our list of reward tiers offered, executing the fulfilment is going to take some knowhow, problem solving and honing to get it running smoothly. Once funded, we are confident that our new Strategic Planning Director will be able to get the job done, proactively tackling challenges and getting the rewards to you with the Indiegogo definition of “on time.”

column1:
Product Adjustments - Creativity and quality never ceases. Again, from experience, we find better and faster ways to produce top-of-the-line products with a little fine tuning here and there. As you can tell from our concept model to the product we have now, there are vast changes made—such as our assembly kits to 80% pre-assembled— all to better benefit your experience as the end user. Some people don’t like surprises, so we aim to keep you up to date on any improvements made. 

Overseas Shipping– Once funded, oversees shipping will be considered, but we’re not there yet. The process of customs, delays, extra charges is something to consider and other things we are not familiar with at this stage and can’t guarantee delivery on time with the potential for bandits and pirates trading it on the black market?? Nevertheless, you can count on… most of us to get there and face the challenges and risks head on with hopefully no causalities.

It is not unexpected that there will be dog days ahead, but with your help, we can keep the barking and howling to a minimum. In order to get your paws on one of our rewards, scroll up and select “Back This Project.”

","After months of planning, our family's Indiegogo campaign, ""Going to the Dogs!"" will raise funds for the production of the World's First Reversible Spiral Pet Staircase. Not only is this a kick start for our business that went to the dogs in 2010 due to the recession, but the beginning of fashionable pet safety through Much-a-chunk, our new pet product line and brand.
Read on to learn more about our story and how you can have the opportunity to receive awesome rewards shown in our Gallery by supporting the campaign! #SaveTheDogs!

Once funded, we are confident that our new Strategic Planning Director will be able to get the job done, proactively tackling challenges and getting the rewards to you with the Indiegogo definition of “on time.”

Product Adjustments - Creativity and quality never ceases. Again, from experience, we find better and faster ways to produce top-of-the-line products with a little fine tuning here and there. As you can tell from our concept model to the product we have now, there are vast changes made—such as our assembly kits to 80% pre-assembled— all to better benefit your experience as the end user. Some people don’t like surprises, so we aim to keep you up to date on any improvements made. Overseas Shipping– Once funded, oversees shipping will be considered, but we’re not there yet. The process of customs, delays, extra charges is something to consider and other things we are not familiar with at this stage and can’t guarantee delivery on time with the potential for bandits and pirates trading it on the black market?? Nevertheless, you can count on… most of us to get there and face the challenges and risks head on with hopefully no causalities.

It is not unexpected that there will be dog days ahead, but with your help, we can keep the barking and howling to a minimum. In order to get your paws on one of our rewards, scroll up and select “Back This Project.”

over to the next-door neighbor to get his necktie tied? Well, guess what, here's your solution! Learn how to tie a finished necktie knot in seconds with NeckTie Jr.!!!

column6:
>A Different Kind of Tiny House

The tiny house movement is exploding and the millennial RV culture is starting to BOOM! It’s an exciting time to be a designer and builder, and even more exciting to explore new ideas within this movement.

My name is Daniel, and I’ve been working on an idea, a dream, for the past 5 years, to cast off the rental contracts and finally have a space of my own. A space that I can design and build and share with people wherever I travel or settle. A home that will be Off the Grid and On the Road.

Acorn! The trailer, named “Acorn” will be a ground up custom construction of a tiny home, conforming to the general typology of recreational travel trailers (offering maximum roadworthiness and adventure!). But branching away from typical RV’s in many ways. It will be an off-grid, self-sufficient machine for living. And beautifully crafted, by a perfectionist designer/builder with a furniture level attention to detail.
column18:
>Who Am I? Where Am I?

My name is Daniel Goers. I’ve spent the last 6 years making things! In 2009, during the recession, I moved away from my career as an Architectural Designer. This set me up well for becoming a carpenter’s assistant, and eventually, opening and running my own furniture and fabrication business in the Gowanus neighborhood of Brooklyn NY. I started the studio Autumn Workshop, which put out many furniture designs that blend natural elements and plants with indoor furniture and lighting. And I took on crazy outdoor construction jobs building gardens and green roofs all over Manhattan and Brooklyn. But my nomadic nature and green thumb overcame me. I’ve spent the last year doing renovation and farm work in Virginia and planning THIS project.

Over the last year, I have finally made huge steps in bringing Acorn to life. In January, I bought a badly damaged 1975 Vega Travel Trailer in the snowy mountains of West Virginia. On a farm in Northern VA, my partner and I dismantled the old structure, salvaging what was still good, and renovating the trailer frame. I now had the “foundation” of my dream, ready to go!
column20:
/>

In October, I relocated my operation to Greenville South Carolina, where I have access to a garage. I’ve made a great little shop space, fully equipped to build the trailer and store materials. I’ve poured countless hours of research and design time into fully designing every detail of the project, filling notebooks with sketches and using Architectural and 3D modeling software.

Now I’m in the last stretch of the project, having collected tons of materials. I’m ready to start framing. I’m ready to BUILD!
column25:
>Break It Down! Help Me Out!

My project needs an Indigogo community infusion! I have put in the entirety of my personal funds into this project, but the next phase necessitates help. And it offers me an opportunity to share my dream project.

Today I am seeking help of $4,500+ to cover the remaining costs of the project build, share information about the project, and to expand current design features. Check out what I’ve already put into it!

My initial investment ($5k+) covered the cost of the original vintage 1975 Vega Travel Trailer, the demolition and renovation costs of the steel trailer itself, the insulated platform to build off of, and thousands of dollars of finish and building materials, fixtures, tool upgrades, and systems components.

The breakdown of future funding will look like this:
column30:
>Open Source Perk!

I believe in an Open Source culture and a free exchange of ideas! I am a self taught craftsman, and without the friends and colleagues around me, and the sharing of ideas and imagery online, I never would be where I am today. Countless hours of research and forum posts and youtube videos contributed to every design decision. I want to pay it forward with this campaign and really, with all my projects!

Acorn Project Book: My primary offering for this campaign will be a very detailed, financially and process transparent Project Book. Using online self-publishing resources, the 30 page color 7”x9” photobook will include descriptions of the project and vision, full budgetary breakdowns, design drawings, anecdotes and tips about construction, and high res photos of the construction process and finalized project.

A printed version will be available for contributors at certain levels (It cost me ~$17 to print a book) and a PDF version will be available to everyone who donates. Also, In the spirit of Open Source, I will also share the PDF online for anyone after 6 months from publishing.
column35:
>Other Perks

In addition to the Project Book, I have a handful of perks that I am really excited to offer.

Stay in Touch: First, I can’t wait to send out a ton of postcards and photos to all my contributors! I have a lot of travels planned. For starters, a cross country trip from South Carolina to Portland, Oregon, passing through the Southern United States. It will be Acorn (the trailer) and Quail (my van) along with me and Mars (my cat!). I want to connect to the people that make my project possible and I hope many penpals and friendships come from it.

Come on By: Next, I want to share my process and give in-person talks and tours of the Acorn House. If you are in geographic proximity to certain places, I will be happy to host studio visits (during construction) and house visits (once settled in the Pacific Northwest). And for those in the Portland area, we can arrange a 1-2 night stay for you and your family in the space (I’ll just go camping for the night!).

Green Thumb: Lastly, I have a couple of remaining furniture pieces from the design and fabrication shop I ran for many years. These include the last two “Hanging Garden Lamps” which are carefully crafted LED lamps that illuminate a resin lined planting area. One is built from reclaimed Teak and the other from Oak and framed in blackened steel. The warm LED lights offer just enough light to keep a low-light plant growing, or supplement natural light for other types of plantings. They cast really amazing ambient light for a modern home. Can be put on a surface or suspended from attachment points at either end. You can learn more about the available lamps HERE.
column40: >More About Acorn
column44: >It's exciting to for me to finally build something for myself! Luckily, I have been collecting materials for this project for months now! Some of the highlights of the planned design include:

column1: • Salvaged Butternut Countertop w/ Walnut Kitchen Sink
• Salvaged Cedar Lined Shower and Toilet Room w/ Composting Toilet
• Salvaged, Original Trailer Windows and Door Frame
• Solar System and Battery Bank for Off-Grid Living
• High Efficiency Systems: LP Gas Heat and Cooking, LED Lighting
• Fully Designed Interior, Down to the Square Inch, for Storage/Space Efficiency
• Integrated Cat LItter Box Area and Cat Door (obviously)

column11:
>Challenges and Other Ways You Can Help

This project is being primarily constructed by myself, with some key help along the way. My main challenge right now is funding the critical upcoming, expensive components (insulation, systems components, solar setup). But also finding physical help! I am actively looking for volunteers on Craigslist and through word of mouth. An extra set of hands makes building things easier, and another human around makes the project fun! So if you’re in the Greenville area, and you have time on your hands, let me know!

Of course, every enthusiast who really reads through all this knows that the power of crowdfunding is in reaching the biggest crowd! Please, share this project with folks!

Share on Facebook and Twitter! Check out the #AcornTrailer hashtag on Instagram. And Email me if you want to ask a question.

Let’s make this Acorn sprout!

column2: >Sans Soucie + Zero Waste Fashion + 30 days = London Fashion Week
column5:
/>

Behind the scenes from a recent outdoor shoot on location in Vancouver


Sans Soucie Textile + Design has been invited to showcase at the Oxford Studio during London Fashion Week on September 19th.

As we have not presented a runway collection since 2013 (Eco Fashion Week, April 2013), this invitation is very timely as pieces from our archive will be on display at the Canadian Embassy (Canada House, Trafalgar Square) as part of the the Design in Canada exhibition.  In addition to our LFW showcase, we will be part of an In-Conversation on September 21 at Canada House with fellow Vancouver furniture designer Judson Beaumont of Straightline Designs as part of the events being held during the London Design Festival. 

photo by: Shimon Karmel, Vanitas Collection, 2010, Design in Canada Exhibition, Canada House,  Trafalgar Square, London, UK.
column8:
>We have been spent time in our Vancouver studio this past year prototyping and  developing concepts with our signature hosiery material process. Through our creative explorations we have been mapping out the future direction of Sans Soucie.  This includes acquiring our own textile mill to produce recycled nylon hosiery and recycled blended hosiery fabrics for the retail market. But where do our one of kind collections fit in? Well, our couture and one of kind collections are dependent on the waste we acquire. Without waste, which is our creative driving factor it makes it difficult. After the threat of mills closing in Canada and the slow shift to re-shoring manufacturing back to North America we know that by acquiring our own mill we can be sure to continue our unique textile recycling process with the waste that is inevitably produced through manufacturing means. This is an exciting goal for us to achieve, which will take some time but as we build towards our goal and maintain our relationships with existing hosiery mills, the future has never looked brighter. 


Behind the scenes from a recent outdoor shoot on location in Vancouver. 

Although we have been fortunate to have had time to develop and restructure our business and studio practice producing a collection for the runway requires assistance. 

In accepting this invitation we will need to raise funding to help produce, document, promote, ship and travel to and from Vancouver -->
column9: London.  We are aiming to reach our goal of 10,000 (USD) over the next 30 days.  We hope that you will either consider contributing or sharing amongst your friends. <div>

column1:
Please share and/or follow us online or on social media. 

To view our work please visit www.sanssoucie.ca 

To purchase work visit our Etsy Store
http://www.etsy.com/shop/sanssoucie

Follow us on Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/sanssoucietextiles

Follow us on Instagram 
https://instagram.com/sanssoucietextiles/

Follow on Twitter 
https://twitter.com/katherinesoucie 

For those of you that do know our work, our textiles have a story to tell and it is a story that speaks of transformation, creativity, empowerment and a love for our environment and what we do. By showcasing a collection during London Fashion Week this will allow for this message, our message to be seen and heard through a platform designed for an international audience. We have always believed our work is universal and we work very hard every day to try and take the steps we need to make this happen.

                           We believe in the saying "" if you build they will come"" 


Stretch Goal
If we break $10,000 any additional funding will go towards additional assistance for our production needs post runway presentation, website update/maintenance, photography, etc.

As we have not presented a runway collection since 2013 (Eco Fashion Week, April 2013), this invitation is very timely as pieces from our archive will be on display at the Canadian Embassy (Canada House, Trafalgar Square) as part of the the Design in Canada exhibition.  In addition to our LFW showcase, we will be part of an In-Conversation on September 21 at Canada House with fellow Vancouver furniture designer Judson Beaumont of Straightline Designs as part of the events being held during the London Design Festival. photo by: Shimon Karmel, Vanitas Collection, 2010, Design in Canada Exhibition, Canada House,  Trafalgar Square, London, UK. We have been spent time in our Vancouver studio this past year prototyping and  developing concepts with our signature hosiery material process. column9:
>OUR PRODUCT

We’ve thoughtfully re-imagined the dress shirt from the ground up:

Ring around the collar on Dress Shirts has been a thorn in the side of housewives forever. Just like any issue, you can react to it, or you can prevent it.

You might not have a dirty neck but still have ring around the collar. Body oils can attract dirt...and you don't have to be outside in a dust storm to get the dirty ring. There are plenty of pollutants inside buildings to help with this.

There is even evidence that eating certain foods, like greasy fried foods, can cause the body oils to tarnish your collar.


We believe in the old fashioned way in terms of attention to detail and top quality materials to deliver a truly superior product:

That’s why we took our time in testing the idea of a shirt collar liner and after establishing a proof of concept we went ahead and tested different fabrics that would do an excellent job in acting as a comfortable and invisible barrier in preventing collar stains. The result? Men who wear dress shirts will be very happy thanks to dramatically lower dry cleaning bills. Wives and girlfriends will be even happier. That’s because they’ll never need to fuss with ring around the collar again.

With one easy pull, you’ve just removed the sweat and stains you’ve been accustomed to seeing embedded in your shirt collar.

We believe that if you’re going to do something it’s worth doing it right:

We have not only perfected the correct breathable
column12: absorbent fabric, but have customized our collar liners to be specially contoured and adjustable for a custom fit.
column17:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

OUR STORY

It all started 4 years ago when I was working as a Financial services consultant. As per the industry rules, I had to suit up every day to meet with clients. I've noticed that it was almost impossible to keep my shirt collar clean, even for a half day, and no matter how hard I brushed my neck it was impossible to keep that part of the shirt clean. I had to take my shirts for dry cleaning almost every day. The cost of dry cleaning was getting out of hand and after a while I noticed the stains were so strong that it looked like the shirt wasn't clean at all.

I started looking for different ways to clean my shirts collar
column18:
there were a lot theories but nothing was really solving the problem. To help the situation, my wife used to put a tissue on the back of my neck just to absorb the dirt or sweat build up or whatever it is that makes the stains. Except at the end of the day the tissue would tear off and sometimes it came out. There had to be something more permanent and practical that would protect the shirt collar.

After much practice and research, we made a couple of designs and discovered the material that should be used with the different patterns. ET VOILA !!! The PIC (''Protecteur Interieur de Col'') was born.

Now, we believe this little accessory will not only make your life simple but it will also reduce your dry cleaning bills, not to mention that you will be able to keep that favorite shirt longer and it is very easy to use !!!

We believe this product should not only be found on the Internet, we want to bring this amazing little lifesaver to a department store near you. We hope with your help, we will be able to make another step forward to that direction.


MISSION

If you’re like millions of other people in the world that are tired of using destructive cleaners or chemicals to get the sweat and oil stains out of your shirt collar, or, hate rubbing your knuckles to the bone scrubbing your shirts, then you’ll be thrilled to know that ColPro has come to the rescue.

Quality: We are first and foremost focused on producing great products, and it’s not just a matter of pride: well-designed, giving our customers the value they deserve.

People: There are many people involved in bringing clothing from “dirt to shirt.” We chose — deliberately — to work with suppliers who embrace fair labor practices and safe working conditions.

Why Pledge?

Don’t be the laugh of the office with embarrassing, stained shirt collars.
Attend business meetings with confidence knowing you don’t have ring-around-the-collar.
Extend the life of your shirts…….. Save Money $$$$.
Extend wears between washing or dry cleaning……. Save Money $$$$.
No need to scrub or use abrasive chemicals to clean your collars.
Soft, silky comfort around your neck makes wearing a tie an enjoyable experience.
